A006369.name: a(n) = 2*n/3 for n divisible by 3, otherwise a(n) = round(4*n/3). Or, equivalently, a(3*n-2) = 4*n-3, a(3*n-1) = 4*n-1, a(3*n) = 2*n.
formula: The map is: n -> if n mod 3 = 0 then 2*n/3 elif n mod 3 = 1 then (4*n-1)/3 else (4*n+1)/3.
a(n) = (2 - ((2*n + 1) mod 3) mod 2) * floor((2*n + 1)/3) + (2*n + 1) mod 3 - 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 23 2005
a(n) = n + floor((n+1)/3)*(-1)^((n+1) mod 3). - _Bruno Berselli_, Dec 10 2015
a(n) = 2*a(n-3) - a(n-6) for n >= 6. - _Werner Schulte_, Mar 16 2021

A006370.name: The Collatz or 3x+1 map: a(n) = n/2 if n is even, 3n + 1 if n is odd.
formula: a(n) = ((n mod 2)*2 + 1)*n/(2 - (n mod 2)) + (n mod 2). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 12 2002
a(n) = a(a(2*n)) = -A001281(-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 10 2016

A006371.name: Number of reduced binary quadratic forms of discriminant -n.

A006372.name: Numbers of terms in expressions for coefficients of "Lovelock Lagrangians" (or "Gauss-Bonnet forms") in terms of Riemann-Christoffel curvature tensor and two of its contractions (viz., the Ricci curvature tensor and the Riemann curvature scalar) for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

A006373.name: Numbers of terms in expressions for coefficients of Euler-Lagrange tensors in terms of Riemann-Christoffel curvature tensor and two of its contractions (viz., the Ricci curvature tensor and the Riemann curvature scalar) for n-dimensional differentiable manifolds having a general linear connection.

A006374.name: Number of positive definite reduced binary quadratic forms of discriminant -4*n.

A006375.name: Number of reduced indefinite binary forms of determinant -n.

A006376.name: Number of indecomposable positive definite ternary quadratic forms of determinant n.

A006377.name: Determinants of indecomposable indefinite ternary quadratic forms.

A006378.name: Prime self (or Colombian) numbers: primes not expressible as the sum of an integer and its digit sum.

A006379.name: Number of noncyclic (finite) simple groups with n conjugacy classes.

A006380.name: Number of equivalence classes of 4 X n binary matrices when one can permute rows, permute columns and complement columns.

A006381.name: Number of n X 3 binary matrices under row and column permutations and column complementations.

A006382.name: Number of n X 4 binary matrices under row and column permutations and column complementations.

A006383.name: Number of equivalence classes of n X n binary matrices when one can permute rows, permute columns and complement columns.

A006384.name: Number of planar maps with n edges.
formula: For n>0, a(n) = (1/2n)[A'(n)+sum_{k<n,k|n}phi(n/k) binomial(k+2,2) A'(k)]+q(n) where phi(n) is the Euler function A000010, q(n)=(n+3) A'(n-1/2)/4 if n is odd and q(n) = (n-1)A'(n-2/2)/4 if n is even, where A'(n)=A000168(n), the number of rooted maps. - _Valery A. Liskovets_, May 27 2006

Equivalently, a(n) = (1/2n)[2*3^n/((n+1)(n+2))*binomial(2n,n) +sum_{k<n,k|n} phi(n/k)3^k*binomial(2k,k)]+q(n) where q(n)=2*3^((n-1)/ 2)/ (n+1)*binomial(n-1,(n-1)/2) if n is odd and q(n)=2(n-1)*3^((n-2)/2)/ (n(n+2))*binomial(n-2,(n-2)/2) if n is even. - _Valery A. Liskovets_, May 27 2006

A006385.name: Number of connected planar maps with n edges.

A006386.name: Number of unrooted maps with n edges on the torus.

A006387.name: Number of unsensed genus 1 maps with n edges.

A006388.name: Number of planar maps with n edges and without faces of degree 1.

A006389.name: Number of unsensed planar maps with n edges and without faces of degree 1.

A006390.name: Number of unrooted loopless planar n-edge maps.
formula: a(n) = (1/(2n))*[2(4n+1)*binomial(4n, n)/((n+1)*(3n+1)*(3n+2)) + Sum_{0<k<n, k|n}phi(n/k)*binomial(4k, k)+q(n)] where phi is the Euler function (A000010), q(n)=binomial(2n, (n-2)/2) if n is even and q(n)=2n*binomial(2n, (n-1)/2)/(n+1) if n is odd.

A006391.name: Number of unsensed planar maps with n edges and without loops.

A006392.name: Number of planar maps with n edges and without faces of degree 1 or 2.

A006393.name: Number of unsensed planar maps with n edges and without faces of degree 1 or 2.

A006394.name: Number of connected planar maps with n nodes and without loops or parallel edges.

A006395.name: Number of unsensed connected planar maps with n nodes and without loops or parallel edges.

A006396.name: Number of planar maps with n edges and without faces or vertices of degree 1.

A006397.name: Number of unsensed planar maps with n edges and without faces or vertices of degree 1.

A006398.name: Number of planar maps with n edges and without loops or isthmuses.

A006399.name: Number of unsensed planar maps with n edges and without loops or isthmuses.

A006400.name: Number of connected planar maps without vertices of degree 1.

A006401.name: Number of connected planar maps without vertices of degree 1.

A006402.name: Number of sensed 2-connected (nonseparable) planar maps with n edges.

A006403.name: Number of 2-connected planar maps with n edges.

A006404.name: Number of 2-connected maps without faces of degree 2.

A006405.name: Number of unsensed 2-connected maps without faces of degree 2.

A006406.name: Number of 2-connected planar maps with n edges (see reference for precise definition).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=3..n} A342059(k, n+2-k). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 27 2021

A006407.name: Number of unsensed 2-connected planar maps with n edges.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=3..n} A342060(k, n+2-k). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 27 2021

A006408.name: Number of nonseparable rooted toroidal maps with n + 3 edges and n + 1 vertices.

A006409.name: Number of nonseparable rooted toroidal maps with n + 4 edges and n + 1 vertices.
formula: a(n) = 10 * binomial(n + 4, 6) + 120 * binomial(n + 4, 7) + 328 * binomial(n + 4, 8) + 232 * binomial(n + 4, 9) [From Walsh]. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 03 2017

A006410.name: Number of nonseparable rooted toroidal maps with n + 5 edges and n + 1 vertices.
formula: a(n) = 20 * binomial(n + 6, 8) + 471 * binomial(n + 6, 9) + 2734 * binomial(n + 6, 10) + 5388 * binomial(n + 6, 11) + 3264 * binomial(n + 6, 12) [From Walsh]. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 03 2017

A006411.name: Number of nonseparable tree-rooted planar maps with n + 2 edges and 3 vertices.
formula: a(n) = binomial(n+2,n)*binomial(n+2,n-1) - binomial(n+2,n+1)*binomial(n+2,n-2). - _J. M. Bergot_, Apr 07 2013

A006412.name: Number of nonseparable tree-rooted planar maps with n + 3 edges and 4 vertices.
formula: a(n) = 4 * binomial(n + 4, 5) + 51 * binomial(n + 4, 6) + 163 * binomial(n + 4, 7) + 194 * binomial(n + 4, 8) + 78 * binomial(n + 4, 9). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 03 2017

A006413.name: Number of nonseparable tree-rooted planar maps with n + 4 edges and 5 vertices.
formula: a(n) = 5 * binomial(n + 6, 7) + 170 * binomial(n + 6, 8) + 1440 * binomial(n + 6, 9) + 4906 * binomial(n + 6, 10) + 7927 * binomial(n + 6, 11) + 6090 * binomial(n + 6, 12) + 1794 * binomial(n + 6, 13). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 03 2017

A006414.name: Number of nonseparable toroidal tree-rooted maps with n + 2 edges and n + 1 vertices.
formula: a(n) = (Sum_{k=0..n+1} k*(n+1)*((n+1)^2 - k^2))/6 for n > 0, which is the sum of all areas of Pythagorean triangles with arms 2*k*(n+1) and (n+1)^2 - k^2 with hypotenuse k^2 + (n+1)^2. - _J. M. Bergot_, May 12 2014

a(n) = binomial(n+5, 5) + 3*binomial(n+4, 5) + binomial(n+3, 5) = ((n+2)/2)*(binomial(n+4, 4) + binomial(n+3, 4)), for n >= 0. See a comment above on the sequence b(n) = a(n-2) = n^3*(n^2 - 1)/4!. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 19 2019

A006415.name: Number of nonseparable toroidal tree-rooted maps with n + 3 edges and n + 1 vertices.
formula: Conjecture: a(n) = 4 * binomial(n + 4, n) + 84 * binomial(n + 4, n - 1) + 456 * binomial(n + 4, n - 2) + 996 * binomial(n + 4, n - 3) + 950 * binomial(n + 4, n - 4) + 330 * binomial(n + 5, n - 5). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 03 2017

A006416.name: Number of loopless rooted planar maps with 3 faces and n vertices and no isthmuses. Also a(n)=T(4,n-3), array T as in A049600.

A006417.name: Number of loopless rooted planar maps with 4 faces and n vertices and no isthmuses.

A006418.name: Number of loopless rooted planar maps with 5 faces and n vertices and no isthmuses.

A006419.name: a(n) = 2^(2*n+1) - C(2*n+3,n+1) + C(2*n+1,n).
formula: G.f.: c(x)^3*x/(1-4x) where c(x) = g.f. for the Catalan numbers A000108. - _Philippe Deléham_, Jun 02 2013

a(n) = Integral_{x=0..4} x^n*W(x)*dx, n >= 0, is the integral representation as n-th moment of a signed weight function W(x), where W(x) = W_a(x) + W_c(x), with W_a(x) = 2*Dirac(x-4), which is the discrete (atomic) part, and W_c(x) = (1/(2*Pi))*(1-x)*sqrt(x/(4-x)) is the continuous part of W(x): W_c(0) = W_c(1) = 0, W_c(x) > 0 for x < 1, lim_{x->4} W_c(x) = -oo. - _Karol A. Penson_, Jul 31 2013 [edited by _Michel Marcus_, Mar 14 2020]
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(2*(n+1), n-k-1). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Oct 23 2016

A006420.name: Number of rooted planar maps with 3 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006421.name: Number of rooted planar maps with 4 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006422.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 2 faces and n vertices and without separating cycles or isthmuses.

A006423.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 3 faces and n vertices and without separating cycles or isthmuses.

A006424.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 4 faces and n vertices and without separating cycles or isthmuses.

A006425.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 2 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006426.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 3 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006427.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 4 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006428.name: Number of loopless tree-rooted planar maps with 3 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.
formula: a(n) seems to be divisible by n+1. - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 01 2003
Conjecture (for n > 1): a(n) = n*(n+1)*(n^3+6*n^2+11*n-42) / 24. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 10 2017
The above conjectures are true. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 03 2021

A006429.name: Number of loopless tree-rooted planar maps with 4 vertices and n faces.

A006430.name: Number of loopless tree-rooted planar maps with 5 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006431.name: Numbers that have a unique partition into a sum of four nonnegative squares.
formula: Consists of the seven odd numbers 1, 3, 5, 7, 11, 15, 23, plus 0, and numbers of forms 2*4^k, 6*4^k, 14*4^k, k >= 0.

A006432.name: Number of tree-rooted planar maps with 3 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.
formula: a(n) seems to be divisible by n+1. - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 01 2003

A006433.name: Number of tree-rooted planar maps with 4 vertices and n faces and no isthmuses.

A006434.name: Number of tree-rooted toroidal maps with 2 faces and n vertices and without separating loops or isthmuses.

A006435.name: Number of tree-rooted toroidal maps with 3 faces and n vertices and without separating loops or isthmuses.

A006436.name: Number of tree-rooted toroidal maps with 2 faces and n vertices and without isthmuses.

A006437.name: Number of tree-rooted toroidal maps with 3 faces and n vertices and without isthmuses.

A006438.name: Expansion of e.g.f. 1/sqrt(1-8x+x^2).
formula: D-finite with recurrence: a(n+2) = 4*(2*n+3)*a(n+1) -(n+1)^2*a(n); a(0)=1, a(1)=4. - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 12 2012

A006439.name: Number of tree-rooted toroidal maps with 2 faces and n vertices and without separating loops.

A006440.name: Number of tree-rooted toroidal maps with 3 faces and n vertices and without separating loops.

A006441.name: Number of nonseparable toroidal tree-rooted maps with n + 4 edges and n + 1 vertices.

A006442.name: Expansion of 1/sqrt(1-10*x+x^2).
formula: Legendre polynomial evaluated at 5. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 04 2001
a(n) = central coefficient of (1+5*x+6*x^2)^n. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 03 2003
a(n) equals the (n+1)-th term of the binomial transform of 1/(1-2x)^(n+1). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 29 2003
a(n)=sum(k=0, n, 2^k*binomial(n, k)*binomial(n+k, k)) - _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 13 2004
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n,k)^2 * 2^k * 3^(n-k). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 04 2012
D-finite with recurrence: n*a(n) -5*(2n-1)*a(n-1)+(n-1)*a(n-2)=0 [Eq (4) in the T. D. Noe article]. _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 26 2012
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} 2^k * C(2*k, k) * C(n+k, n-k). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Aug 17 2014
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (k+1) * 3^k * (-1)^(n-k) * binomial(n,k) * binomial(n+k+1,n) / (n+k+1). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Nov 23 2014

A006443.name: Number of connected planar maps with n edges.

A006444.name: Number of 2-connected planar maps with n edges.

A006445.name: Number of n-edge 3-connected planar maps with a sense-reversing automorphism.

A006446.name: Numbers k such that floor(sqrt(k)) divides k.
formula: For k>=1 a(3*k-2) = k^2, a(3*k-1) = k*(k+1) and a(3*k) = k*(k+2). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 14 2012

A006447.name: Consider a 2-D cellular automaton generated by the Schrandt-Ulam rule of A170896, but confined to a semi-infinite strip of width n, starting with one ON cell at the top left corner; a(n) is the period of the resulting structure.

A006448.name: Number of n-element algebras with 1 binary operator and 1 constant (pointed groupoids).

A006449.name: Row sums of Fibonacci-Pascal triangle in A045995.

A006450.name: Prime-indexed primes: primes with prime subscripts.
formula: a(n) > n*(log(n))^2, as prime(n) > n*log(n) by Rosser's theorem. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Jul 11 2012
Sum_{n>=1} 1/a(n) is in the interval (1.04299, 1.04365) (Bayless et al., 2013). - _Amiram Eldar_, Oct 15 2020

A006451.name: Numbers n such that n*(n+1)/2+1 is a square.
formula: G.f.: x*(-2-3*x+2*x^2+x^3)/(x-1)/(x^2+2*x-1)/(x^2-2*x-1). Conjectured (correctly) by _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation.
a(n) = 7*a(n-2) - 7*a(n-4) + a(n-6), for n>5. - _Hermann Stamm-Wilbrandt_, Aug 26 2014
a(2*n) = A098586(2*n-1), for n>0. - _Hermann Stamm-Wilbrandt_, Aug 27 2014

A006453.name: Expansion of 1/sqrt(1-12x+x^2).
formula: D-finite with recurrence: a(n) +6*(-2*n+1)*a(n-1) +(n-1)^2*a(n-2)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 17 2020

A006454.name: Solution to a Diophantine equation: each term is a triangular number and each term + 1 is a square.
formula: Note that A216134(n + 1) = x + y, and A216134(n + 3) = (2x + 3y + 1) + (3x + 4y + 1) = (5x + 7y + 2), where A216134 gives the indices of the Sophie Germain triangular numbers. (End)
Since b(n) = 8*sqrt(T(b(n-2))+1)+ b(n-4) = 8*sqrt((b(n-2)*(b(n-2)+1)/2)+1)+ b(n-4), with b(-1)=-1, b(0)=0, b(1)=2, b(2)=5 (see A006451) and a(n) = T(b(n)) (this sequence), we have:

A006455.name: Number of partial orders on {1,2,...,n} that are contained in the usual linear order (i.e., xRy => x<y).

A006456.name: Number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n into squares.
formula: a(n) = 1, if n = 0;  a(n)=Sum(1 <= k^2 <= n, a(n-k^2)), if n > 0. - _David W. Wilson_
G.f.: 2/(3 - theta_3(q)), where theta_3() is the Jacobi theta function. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 08 2018

A006457.name: Number of elements in Z[ i ] whose `smallest algorithm' is <= n.

A006458.name: Number of elements in Z[ omega ] whose `smallest algorithm' is <= n, where omega^2 = -omega - 1.

A006459.name: Number of elements in Z[ sqrt(-2) ] whose `smallest algorithm' is <= n.

A006460.name: Image of n after 3k iterates of `3x+1' map (k large).

A006461.name: Percolation series for directed square lattice.

A006462.name: Percolation series for directed square lattice.

A006463.name: Convolve natural numbers with characteristic function of triangular numbers.
formula: G.f.: (psi(x) - 1) * x / (1 - x)^2 where psi() is a Ramanujan theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 06 2006
a(n) = sum_(k=0..n-1) A003056(k). - Daniele Parisse (daniele.parisse(AT)eads.com), Jul 10 2007
a(n+1) - 2*a(n) + a(n-1) = A010054(n) if n>0. - _Michael Somos_, May 07 2016

A006468.name: Number of rooted planar maps with 4 faces and n vertices and no isthmuses.
formula: G.f.: -x*(x^3-4*x^2+2*x+5)/(x-1)^7, equivalent to a(n) = n *(n+1) *(n+2) *(2*n^3 +33*n^2 +142*n +123) /360, conjectured in _Simon Plouffe_'s Master's thesis, 1992.
The above conjecture is true. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 02 2021

A006469.name: Number of rooted toroidal maps with 2 faces, n vertices and no isthmuses.
formula: G.f.: x/(x-1)^7*(3*x^2-9*x-10). - _Simon Plouffe_, Master's thesis, Uqam 1992

A006470.name: Number of tree-rooted planar maps with 3 faces and n vertices and no isthmuses.

A006471.name: Number of tree-rooted planar maps with 4 faces and n vertices and no isthmuses.

A006472.name: a(n) = n!*(n-1)!/2^(n-1).
formula: a(n) = polygorial(n, 3) = (A000142(n)/A000079(n))*A000142(n+1) = (n!/2^n)*Product_{i=0..n-1} (i+2) = (n!/2^n)*Pochhammer(2, n) = (n!^2/2^n)*(n+1) = polygorial(n, 4)/2^n*(n+1). - Daniel Dockery (peritus(AT)gmail.com), Jun 13 2003
a(n-1) = (-1)^(n+1)/(n^2*det(M_n)) where M_n is the matrix M_(i, j) = abs(1/i - 1/j). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 21 2003

A006476.name: From relations between Siegel theta series.

A006477.name: Number of partitions of n with at least 1 odd and 1 even part.
formula: A000041(n)-A000009(n) if n is odd else A000041(n)-A000009(n)-A000041(n/2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 10 2003

A006478.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-2) + F(n) - 1, a(0) = a(1) = 0, where F() = Fibonacci numbers A000045.
formula: G.f.: x^3/((1-x)*(1-x-x^2)^2). - _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} Sum_{i=0..k} F(i)*F(k-i). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 26 2003
a(n) = 3*a(n-1) - a(n-2) - 3*a(n-3) + a(n-4) + a(n-5). - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Sep 05 2017

A006479.name: From variance of Fibonacci search.
formula: (Conjecture equivalent to Plouffe g.f.): a(n) = -3 -2*A001629(n+2) -3*A001629(n+1) +2*A001628(n-1) +A020701(n+1) . R. J. Mathar, Dec 06 2010

A006480.name: De Bruijn's S(3,n): (3n)!/(n!)^3.
formula: Using Stirling's formula in A000142 it is easy to get the asymptotic expression a(n) ~ 1/2 * sqrt(3) * 27^n / (Pi*n) - Dan Fux (dan.fux(AT)OpenGaia.com or danfux(AT)OpenGaia.com), Apr 07 2001
Integral representation as n-th moment of a positive function on [0, 27]:
D-finite with recurrence: n^2*a(n) - 3*(3*n-1)*(3*n-2)*a(n-1) = 0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 04 2012
0 = x*(27*x-1)*y'' + (54*x-1)*y' + 6*y, where y is g.f. - _Gheorghe Coserea_, Jul 06 2016

a(n) = binomial(2*n,n)*binomial(3*n,n) = ([x^n](1 + x)^(2*n)) *([x^n](1 + x)^(3*n)) = [x^n](F(x)^(6*n)), where F(x) = 1 + x + 2*x^2 + 14*x^3 + 127*x^4 + 1364*x^5 + 16219*x^6 + ... appears to have integer coefficients. Cf. A002894.
This sequence occurs as the right-hand side of several binomial sums:
Sum_{k = 0..n} binomial(n,k)*binomial(2*n,n - k)*binomial(3*n + k,k) = a(n) (Gould, Vol. 4, 6.86)
Sum_{k = 0..2*n} (-1)^(n+k)*binomial(2*n + k,2*n - k)*binomial(2*k,k)*binomial(4*n - k,2*n) = a(n) (see Gould, Vol.5, 9.23).
Sum_{k = 0..2*n} (-1)^k*binomial(3*n,k)*binomial(3*n - k,n)^3 = a(n) (Sprugnoli, Section 2.9, Table 10, p. 123). (End)

A006481.name: Euler characteristics of polytopes.
formula: Numbers suggest that for n not divisible by 4, a(n) = C(n, [n/2]) + 1 and C(n, [(n-1)/2]) + 1 otherwise (see A051920 and A037952+1). - _Ralf Stephan_, Jun 07 2005

A006482.name: Euler characteristics of polytopes.
formula: Numbers suggest that for n>3, a(n) = C(n, [n/2])-1 if (n mod 4)=0 or 1 and C(n, [n/2]-1)-1 otherwise. - _Ralf Stephan_, Jun 07 2005

A006486.name: a(n) = largest prime factor of n^n - 1.

A006487.name: Denominators of greedy Egyptian fraction for square root of 2.
formula: a(n) = ceiling(1/(sqrt(2) - Sum_{j=0..n-1} 1/a(j))). - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Dec 26 2014

A006488.name: Numbers n such that n! has a square number of digits.

A006489.name: Numbers k such that k-6, k, and k+6 are primes.

A006490.name: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 0; for n > 2, a(n) = n*Fibonacci(n-2) (with the convention Fibonacci(0)=0, Fibonacci(1)=1).

A006491.name: Generalized Lucas numbers.
formula: G.f.: x*(1-x)*(1-2*x+2*x^2)/(1-x-x^2)^3. - _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 23 2004, corrected Feb 08 2006
a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-2) + n*Fibonacci(n-2) - (n-1)*Fibonacci(n-3) for n >= 3; a(1)=1, a(2)=0. - _Emeric Deutsch_, May 20 2006

A006494.name: Number of possible chess games at the end of the n-th ply plus number of games that terminate (i.e., mate) in fewer than n plies.

A006495.name: Real part of (1 + 2*i)^n, where i is sqrt(-1).
formula: A000351(n) = a(n)^2 + A006496(n)^2. - Fabrice Baubet (intih(AT)free.fr), May 28 2007
a(n) = upper left and lower right terms of the 2 X 2 matrix [1,-2; 2,1]^n. - _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 28 2008
a(n) = (4*n+5)*a(n-1) - 8*Sum_{k=1..n} a(k-1)*a(n-k) if n > 0. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 23 2011
G.f.: G(0)/2, where G(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - x*(4*k+1)/(x*(4*k+5) + 1/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 26 2013

A006496.name: Imaginary part of (1+2i)^n.
formula: For all n, a(n) = - [M^n]_1,2, where M = [1, -2; 2, 1]. - _Simone Severini_, Apr 25 2007

A006497.name: a(n) = 3*a(n-1) + a(n-2) with a(0) = 2, a(1) = 3.
formula: a(n) = 2*T(n, 3i/2)*(-i)^n with T(n, x) Chebyshev's polynomials of the first kind (see A053120) and i^2=-1. (End)
See A001622 for a general formula concerning the fractional parts of powers of numbers x>1, which satisfy x-x^(-1)=floor(x).
G.f.: G(0), where G(k) = 1 + 1/(1 - (x*(13*k-9))/((x*(13*k+4)) - 6/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Jun 15 2013
a(n) = Lucas(n,3), Lucas polynomials, L(n,x), evaluated at x=3. - _G. C. Greubel_, Jun 06 2019

A006498.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-3) + a(n-4), a(0) = a(1) = a(2) = 1, a(3) = 2.
formula: The g.f. -(1+z+2*z**2+z**3)/((z**2+z-1)*(1+z**2)) for the truncated version 1, 2, 4, 6, 9, 15, 25, 40, ... was given in the _Simon Plouffe_ thesis of 1992. [edited by _R. J. Mathar_, May 13 2008]
a(n) = (-i)^n*Sum{k=0..n} U(n-2k, i/2) where i^2=-1. - _Paul Barry_, Nov 15 2003
F(floor(n/2) + 2)^(n mod 2)*F(floor(n/2) + 1)^(2 - (n mod 2)) where F(n) is the n-th Fibonacci number. - _David Nacin_, Feb 29 2012
a(n+1)*a(n+3) = a(n)*a(n+2) + a(n+1)*a(n+2) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 19 2014
a(n) = round(1/(1/F(n+2) + 2/F(n+3))), where F(n) = A000045, and 0.5 is rounded to 1. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Aug 04 2014
a(n) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/3)} Sum_{k=0..j} binomial(n-3j,k)*binomial(j,k)*2^k. - _Tony Foster III_, Sep 18 2017

A006500.name: Restricted combinations.
formula: a(n) = F(floor(n/3) + 3)^(n mod 3)*F(floor(n/3) + 2)^(3 - (n mod 3)) where F(n) is the n-th Fibonacci number. - _David Nacin_, Feb 29 2012

A006501.name: Expansion of (1+x^2) / ( (1-x)^2 * (1-x^3)^2 ).
formula: Conjecture: a(n) = A144677(n)+A144677(n-2). - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 15 2011

A006504.name: Coefficient of x^4 in (1-x-x^2)^(-n).
formula: The coefficient of x^4 in (1-x-x^2)^{-n} is the coefficient of x^4 in (1+x+2x^2+3x^3+5x^4)^n. Using the multinomial theorem one then finds that a(n)=7n/4+59*n^2/24+3*n^3/4+n^4/24. - Pieter Moree (moree(AT)mpim-bonn.mpg.de), Sep 03 2003

A006505.name: Number of partitions of an n-set into boxes of size >2.
formula: a(n) = n! * sum(m=1..n, sum(k=0..m, k!*(-1)^(m-k) *binomial(m,k) *sum(i=0..n-m, stirling2(i+k,k) *binomial(m-k,n-m-i) *2^(-n+m+i)/ (i+k)!))/m!); a(0)=1. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Feb 01 2011
Define polynomials g_n by g_0=1, g_1=g_2=0, g_3=g_4=g_5=x; g(n) = x*Sum_{i=0..n-3} binomial(n-1,i)*g_i; then a(n) = g_n(1). [Riordan]

A006506.name: Number of n X n binary matrices with no 2 adjacent 1's, or number of configurations of non-attacking princes on an n X n board, where a "prince" attacks the four adjacent (non-diagonal) squares. Also number of independent vertex sets in an n X n grid.
formula: Limit n ->infty (a(n))^(1/n^2) =c1=1.50304... is the hard square entropy constant A085850. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 16 2003

a(n) appears to behave like A * c3^n * c1^(n^2) where c1 is as above, c3 = 1.143519129587 approximately, A = 1.0660826 approximately. This is based on numerical analysis of a(n) for n up to 19. - _Brendan McKay_, Nov 16 2003

A006507.name: a(n+1) = a(n) + sum of digits of a(n), with a(1)=7.
formula: a(n) = A062028(a(n-1)) for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 14 2013

A006508.name: a(n+1) = a(n)-th composite number, with a(0) = 1.

A006509.name: Cald's sequence: a(n+1) = a(n) - prime(n) if that value is positive and new, otherwise a(n) + prime(n) if new, otherwise 0.

A006511.name: Largest inverse of totient function (A000010): a(n) is the largest x such that phi(x)=m, where m=A002202(n) is the n-th number in the range of phi.

A006513.name: Limit of the image of n after 2k iterates of `(3x+1)/2' map as k grows.

A006514.name: Primes p such that 2^p - 1 has at most 2 prime factors.

A006515.name: Mersenne numbers with at most 2 prime factors.

A006516.name: a(n) = 2^(n-1)*(2^n - 1), n >= 0.
formula: a(n) = StirlingS2(2^n,2^n-1) = binomial(2^n,2). - _Ross La Haye_, Jan 12 2008
Convolution of 4^n and 2^n. - _Ross La Haye_, Oct 29 2004
a(n+2) = 6*a(n+1) - 8*a(n), a(1) = 1, a(2) = 6. - Daniele Parisse (daniele.parisse(AT)eads.com), Jul 28 2006 [Typo corrected by _Yosu Yurramendi_, Aug 06 2008]

Row sums of triangle A134346. Also, binomial transform of A048473: (1, 5, 17, 53, 161, ...); double bt of A151821: (1, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, ...) and triple bt of A010684: (1, 3, 1, 3, 1, 3, ...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 21 2007
a(n) = binomial(2*n+2, n+1) - Catalan(n+2). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 01 2021

A006517.name: Numbers k such that k divides 2^k + 2.

A006519.name: Highest power of 2 dividing n.
formula: a(n) = n AND -n (where "AND" is bitwise, and negative numbers are represented in two's complement in a suitable bit width). - _Marc LeBrun_, Sep 25 2000, clarified by _Alonso del Arte_, Mar 16 2020
Also: a(n) = gcd(2^n, n). - _Labos Elemer_, Apr 22 2003
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^e if p = 2; 1 if p > 2. - _David W. Wilson_, Aug 01 2001
Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)*(2^s - 1)/(2^s - 2) = zeta(s)*(1-2^(-s)/(1 - 2*2^(-s)). - _Ralf Stephan_, Jun 17 2007
a((2*k - 1)*2^e) = 2^e, k >= 1, e >= 0. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 07 2011
a(n) = denominator of Euler(n-1, 1). - _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Jul 12 2012
a(n) = (n XOR floor(n/2)) XOR (n-1 XOR floor((n-1)/2)) = n - (n AND n-1) (where "AND" is bitwise). - _Gary Detlefs_, Jun 12 2014
a(n) = (n-1) o n where 'o' is the bitwise converse nonimplication. 'o' is not commutative. n o (n+1) = A135481(n). - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 10 2019

A006520.name: Partial sums of A006519.
formula: a(n) = b(n+1), with b(2n) = 2b(n) + n, b(2n+1) = 2b(n) + n + 1. - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 07 2003
a(2^k-1) = k*2^(k-1) = A001787(k) for any k > 0. - _Rémy Sigrist_, Jan 21 2021

A006521.name: Numbers n such that n divides 2^n + 1.

A006522.name: 4-dimensional analog of centered polygonal numbers. Also number of regions created by sides and diagonals of a convex n-gon in general position.
formula: a(n) = binomial(n-1,2) + binomial(n-1,3) + binomial(n-1,4). - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 23 2006
For odd n, a(n) = A007678(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 22 2017

A006525.name: Denominators of greedy Egyptian fraction for e - 2.
formula: a(n) = ceiling(1/(e - 2 - Sum_{j=0..n-1} 1/a(j))). - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Dec 26 2014

A006527.name: a(n) = (n^3 + 2*n)/3.
formula: a(n) = ( n + Sum_{i=1..n} A177342(i) )/(n+1), with n > 0. - _Bruno Berselli_, May 19 2010
a(n) = 1*C(n,1) + 2*C(n,2) + 2*C(n,3), where the coefficient of C(n,k) is the number of oriented triangle colorings using exactly k colors.

A006530.name: Gpf(n): greatest prime dividing n, for n >= 2; a(1)=1.
formula: a(n) = n + 1 - Sum_{k=1..n} (floor((k!^n)/n) - floor(((k!^n)-1)/n)). - _Anthony Browne_, May 11 2016
If A020639(n) = n [when n is 1 or a prime] then a(n) = n, otherwise a(n) = a(A032742(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 12 2017
a(n) has average order Pi^2*n/(12 log n) [Brouwer]. See also A046670. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 26 2017

A006531.name: Semiorders on n elements.
formula: E.g.f.: C(1-exp(-x)), where C(x) = (1 - sqrt(1 - 4*x)) / (2*x) is the ordinary g.f. for the Catalan numbers A000108. [corrected by _Joel B. Lewis_, Mar 29 2011]
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} S(n, k) * k! * M(k-1), S(n, k): Stirling number of the second kind, M(n): Motzkin number, A001006. - Detlef Pauly, Jun 06 2002
O.g.f.: Sum_{n>=1} (2*n)!/(n+1)! * x^n / Product_{k=0..n} (1+k*x). [_Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 20 2011]
E.g.f.: 1/(1 + (exp(-x) - 1)/(1 + (exp(-x) - 1)/(1 + (exp(-x) - 1)/(1 + (exp(-x) - 1)/(1 + ...))))), a continued fraction. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Nov 18 2017

Conjecture: for fixed k = 1,2,..., the sequence a(n) (mod k) is eventually periodic with the exact period dividing phi(k), where phi(k) is Euler's totient function A000010. For example, modulo 10 the sequence becomes (1, 1, 3, 9, 3, 1, 3, 9, 3, ...) with an apparent period 1, 3, 9, 3 of length 4 = phi(10) beginning at a(1). (End)

Consider the transformation of a sequence u given by T(u)(m) = (-1)^m*Sum_{n=0..m} (u(n)/(n+1))*(Sum_{k=0..n}(-1)^k*binomial(n,k)*k^m). If u(n) = 1 then T(u)(n) = Bernoulli(n) (with Bernoulli(1) = 1/2), if u(n) = binomial(2*n,n) then T(u)(n) = a(n). - _Peter Luschny_, Jul 09 2020

A006532.name: Numbers n such that sum of divisors of n is a square.

A006533.name: Join n equal points around circle in all ways, count regions.
formula: Poonen and Rubinstein give an explicit formula for a(n) (see Mma code).

A006534.name: Number of one-sided triangular polyominoes (n-iamonds) with n cells; turning over not allowed, holes are allowed.

A006535.name: Number of one-sided hexagonal polyominoes with n cells.

A006539.name: Numerators of worst case for Engel expansion.

A006540.name: Denominators of worst case for Engel expansion.

A006541.name: Number of dissimilarity relations on an n-set.

A006542.name: a(n) = binomial(n,3)*binomial(n-1,3)/4.
formula: a(n) = Sum(Sum(Sum(Sum(1 + Sum(5*n))))) = Sum (A006414). - Xavier Acloque, Oct 08 2003
a(n) = C(n-2, n-4)*C(n-1, n-3)*C(n, n-2)/18. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 29 2005
a(n+2) = (1/4)*Sum_{1 <= x_1, x_2 <= n} x_1*x_2*(det V(x_1,x_2))^2 = (1/4)*Sum_{1 <= i,j <= n} i*j*(i-j)^2, where V(x_1,x_2} is the Vandermonde matrix of order 2. - _Peter Bala_, Sep 21 2007
a(n) = Product_{i=1..3} A002378(n-4+i)/A002378(i). - _Bruno Berselli_, Nov 12 2014 (Rewritten, Sep 01 2016.)

A006543.name: Maximal iterated binomial coefficients.
formula: a(n) = max{(a_1; a_2; ...; a_k)} where a_1,a_2,...,a_k runs over all the compositions of n and (a_1)=a_1, (a_1; a_2) = binomial(a_1, a_2), and (a_1; a_2; ...; a_(k-1); a_k) = ((a_1; a_2; ..., a_(k-1)); a_k). - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 07 2017

A006544.name: Number of stable forests with n nodes.
formula: G.f.: Sum_{n>=1} Z(S_n,s(x)) where s(x) is the g.f. for A003426 and Z(S_n) is the cycle index of the symmetric group on n elements. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Feb 13 2016

A006545.name: Number of stable unicyclic graphs with n nodes.

A006546.name: Number of elements (a b, c d) in SL(2,Z) with trace n and 0 <= a <= {b, c} <= d.

A006549.name: Numbers k such that k and k+1 are prime powers.

A006552.name: Numbers n such that n*3^n + 1 is prime.

A006553.name: Numbers n such that n*3^n - 1 is prime.

A006554.name: Minimal discriminant of totally real number field of degree n.

A006555.name: Minimal absolute value of discriminants of number fields of degree n with exactly 2 (1 pair of) complex embeddings.

A006556.name: Number of different cycles of digits in the decimal expansions of 1/p, 2/p, ..., (p-1)/p where p = n-th prime different from 2 or 5.

A006557.name: Minimal absolute value of discriminants of number fields of degree n.

A006558.name: Start of first run of n consecutive integers with same number of divisors.

A006559.name: Short period primes: the decimal expansion of 1/p has period less than p-1, but greater than zero.

A006560.name: Smallest starting prime for n consecutive primes in arithmetic progression.

A006561.name: Number of intersections of diagonals in the interior of regular n-gon.
formula: Let delta(m,n) = 1 if m divides n, otherwise 0.
- 96*n*delta(90,n) - 144*n*delta(120,n) - 96*n*delta(210,n). [Poonen and Rubinstein, Theorem 1] - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 09 2017

For odd n, binomial(n,4) = n(n-1)(n-2)(n-3)/24, see A053126. For even n, use this formula, but then subtract 2 for every 3-crossing, subtract 5 for every 4-crossing, subtract 9 for every 5-crossing, etc. The number to be subtracted is one smaller than a triangular number. - _Graeme McRae_, Dec 26 2004

A006562.name: Balanced primes (of order one): primes which are the average of the previous prime and the following prime.
formula: Equals { p = prime(k) | A118534(k) = prime(k-1) }. - _Rémi Eismann_, Nov 30 2009
Equals A145025 intersect A000040 = A145025 \ A024675. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 01 2013

A006565.name: Number of ways to color vertices of a hexagon using <= n colors, allowing only rotations.

A006567.name: Emirps (primes whose reversal is a different prime).

A006568.name: Denominators of generalized Bernoulli numbers.
formula: Given a variant of Pascal's triangle (Cf. A209518) in which the two rightmost diagonals are deleted, invert the triangle and extract the leftmost column. Considered as a sequence, we obtain A006568/A006569: (1, -1/3, 1/18, 1/90,...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 09 2012

A006569.name: Numerators of generalized Bernoulli numbers.
formula: Recurrence relation: bernoulli(n+1)=a[n+1]-sum(binomial(n+1, r)*bernoulli(r)*a[n+2-r], r=1..n+1); a[0]=1. (p. 603 of the Howard reference). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 23 2005
E.g.f. for fractions: x^2/2 / (e^x-1-x). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 04 2009

A006570.name: From trees with valency <= 3.
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies 0 = (1 + x) * A(x)^2 + (2*x - 2) * A(x) + (1 + x) * A(x^2) + 2*x. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 13 2014

A006571.name: Expansion of q*Product_{k>=1} (1-q^k)^2*(1-q^(11*k))^2.
formula: Expansion of (eta(q) * eta(q^11))^2 in powers of q.
Euler transform of period 11 sequence [ -2, -2, -2, -2, -2, -2, -2, -2, -2, -2, -4, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 12 2006
a(n) is multiplicative with a(11^e) = 1, a(p^e) = a(p) * a(p^(e-1)) - p * a(p^(e-2)) for p != 11. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 12 2006
G.f. A(q) satisfies 0 = f(A(q), A(q^2), A(q^4)) where f(u, v, w) = u*w * (u + 4*v + 4*w) - v^3. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 21 2005
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (11 t)) = 11 (t/i)^2 f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
Coefficients of L-series for elliptic curve "11a3": y^2 + y = x^3 - x^2. - _Michael Somos_, May 23 2008
Convolution inverse is A032442. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 21 2015
a(2) = -2 is not  2 - A272196(1) = 0. Modularity pattern of some elliptic curves. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Apr 25 2016

A006572.name: Numerators of an asymptotic expansion for the number of forests on n nodes (A001858).

A006573.name: Denominators of an asymptotic expansion for the number of forests on n nodes (A001858).

A006575.name: Number of primitive (aperiodic, or Lyndon) asymmetric rhythm cycles: ones having no nontrivial shift automorphism.
formula: a(n) = (3^n-1)/(2*n) for n=2^k and a(n) = (Sum_{d|n, d odd} mu(d)*3^(n/d))/(2*n) otherwise. (End)

A006577.name: Number of halving and tripling steps to reach 1 in '3x+1' problem, or -1 if 1 is never reached.
formula: a(n) = A112695(n) + 2 for n > 2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 18 2008

A006578.name: Triangular numbers plus quarter squares: n*(n+1)/2 + floor(n^2/4) (i.e., A000217(n) + A002620(n)).
formula: Expansion of x*(1+2*x) / ((1-x)^2*(1-x^2)). - _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation
Partial sums of A032766. - _Paul Barry_, May 30 2003
a(n) = A001859(-1-n) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, May 10 2006
a(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} floor(3*i/2) = Sum_{i=0..n} (i + floor(i/2)). - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Apr 21 2012
a(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} (n - i + 1) * 2^( (i+1) mod 2 ). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 30 2014
a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} floor((n+k+1)/2). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 31 2017

A006579.name: Sum of gcd(n,k) for k = 1 to n-1.
formula: a(p) = p-1 for a prime p.
a(n) = A018804(n)-n = Sum_{ d divides n } (d-1)*phi(n/d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 04 2002
G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} phi(k) * x^(2*k) / (1 - x^k)^2. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Feb 06 2020

A006584.name: If n mod 2 = 0 then n*(n^2-4)/12 else n*(n^2-1)/12.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=1..n} floor(i*(n-i)/2). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 07 2016

A006585.name: Egyptian fractions: number of solutions to 1 = 1/x_1 + ... + 1/x_n in positive integers x_1 < ... < x_n.

A006586.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} floor((2n-1)/(2k+1)).
formula: Clearly a(n) = n log n + O(n); a better estimate is surely possible.

A006589.name: a(n) = (n+3)*2^n-1.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} Sum_{i=0..n} C(n,i) + C(k,i). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 21 2017

A006591.name: Sum_{k = 1..n } nearest integer to n/k (if n/k is midway between two numbers take the smaller).

A006593.name: Least number which is side of n Pythagorean triples.

A006596.name: Numbers n such that (2^{2n+1} - 2^{n+1} + 1)/5 is prime.

A006597.name: a(n) = n^2*(5*n-3)/2.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..n-1} n*(5*i+1) for n>0. [_Bruno Berselli_, Sep 08 2015]

A006598.name: Numbers n such that 2^(2n+1) - 2^(n+1) + 1 is a prime.

A006599.name: Numbers n such that 2^(2n+1) + 2^(n+1) + 1 is prime.

A006600.name: Total number of triangles visible in regular n-gon with all diagonals drawn.

A006601.name: Numbers n such that n, n+1, n+2 and n+3 have the same number of divisors.

A006602.name: a(n) is the number of hierarchical models on n unlabeled factors or variables with linear terms forced.
formula: First differences of A003182. - _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 23 2019

A006605.name: Number of modes of connections of 2n points.
formula: G.f.: A(x) = (1/x)*serreverse(x/G(x)) where G(x) is g.f. of A001006 (Motzkin numbers). G.f. satisfies: A(x)^2 = (1/x)*serreverse( x/(1+x+x^2)^2 ). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 20 2005
G.f.: revogf is 1/2*(-x+1+(-(1+x)*(-1+3*x))^(1/2))*x. - _Simon Plouffe_, Master's Thesis, UQAM 1992
With interpolated zeros, the o.g.f. = series reversion of x/(1 + x^2 + x^4) = x + x^3 + 3*x^5 + 11*x^7 + 46*x^9 + .... - _Peter Bala_, Dec 17 2013

A006606.name: Nonperiodic autocorrelation functions of length n.

A006607.name: Number of labeled connected rooted trivalent graphs with 2n nodes.

A006608.name: Number of n-node graphs not determined by their spectrum.

A006609.name: Number of cyclic neofields of order n.

A006610.name: Number of n-node trees not determined by their spectra.

A006611.name: Number of n-node forests not determined by their spectra.

A006612.name: Number of n-node bipartite graphs not determined by their spectra.

A006627.name: Number of nonisomorphic 2-graphs with n nodes with first and second cohomology invariants both 0.

A006628.name: From a partition of the integers.

A006629.name: Self-convolution 4th power of A001764, which enumerates ternary trees.
formula: G.f.: A(x) = G(x)^4 where G(x) = 1 + x*G(x)^3 = g.f. of A001764 giving a(n)=C(3n+m-1,n)*m/(2n+m) at power m=4 with offset n=0. - _Paul D. Hanna_, May 10 2008

A006630.name: From generalized Catalan numbers.
formula: G.f.: (1-RootOf(x-t*(1-t)^2,t))^(-6) (algebraic function in Maple notation). - _Mark van Hoeij_, Nov 08 2011

A006632.name: a(n) = 3*binomial(4*n-1,n-1)/(4*n-1).
formula: a(n) = binomial(4*n-1, n)/(4*n-1) = 3*binomial(4*n-2, n-1) - binomial(4*n-2, n). - _David Callan_, Sep 15 2004
G.f.: g^3 where g = 1+x*g^4 is the g.f. of A002293. - _Mark van Hoeij_, Nov 11 2011
D-finite with recurrence 3*n*(3*n-1)*(3*n-2)*a(n) -8*(4*n-5)*(4*n-3)*(2*n-1)*a(n-1)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, May 07 2021

A006634.name: From generalized Catalan numbers.
formula: G.f.: g^9 where g = 1+x*g^4 is the g.f. of A002293. - _Mark van Hoeij_, Apr 22 2013

A006635.name: From generalized Catalan numbers.
formula: G.f.: g^12 where g is the g.f. of A002293. - _Sean A. Irvine_, May 25 2017

A006638.name: Restricted postage stamp problem with n denominations and 2 stamps.

A006641.name: Class number of forms with discriminant -A003657(n), or equivalently class number of imaginary quadratic field with discriminant -A003657(n).

A006642.name: Class number of quadratic field with discriminant -4n+1.

A006643.name: Class number of quadratic field with discriminant -4n as n runs through A089269: squarefree numbers congruent to 1 or 2 mod 4.

A006644.name: Indices of records in Landau's function A000793.

A006645.name: Self-convolution of Pell numbers (A000129).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} b(k)*b(n-k) with b(k) := A000129(k).
a(n) = F'(n, 2), the derivative of the n-th Fibonacci polynomial evaluated at x=2. - _T. D. Noe_, Jan 19 2006

A006647.name: Number of graphs with n nodes, n-2 edges and no isolated vertices.

A006648.name: Number of graphs with n nodes, n-1 edges and no isolated vertices.

A006649.name: Number of graphs with n nodes, n edges and no isolated vertices.

A006650.name: Number of graphs with n nodes, n+1 edges and no isolated vertices.

A006651.name: Number of graphs with n nodes, n+2 edges and no isolated vertices.

A006656.name: Denominators of expansion of sinh x / sin x.

A006657.name: Closed meanders with 2 components and 2n bridges.

A006658.name: Closed meanders with 3 components and 2n bridges.

A006659.name: Closed meander systems of order n+1 with n components.

A006660.name: Number of meanders in which first bridge is 3.

A006661.name: Number of meanders in which first bridge is 5.

A006662.name: Number of meanders in which first bridge is 7.

A006664.name: Number of irreducible systems of meanders.
formula: A(x^2) = S(x^2)#inv(x*S(x^2)) where # is functional composition, S(x) is g.f. of A001246 (squares of Catalan numbers) and inv(.) is functional inverse. A(x) consists of even-numbered terms of A(x^2), odd terms of which are 0. - Doug McIlroy (doug(AT)cs.dartmouth.edu), Mar 22 2006

A006666.name: Number of halving steps to reach 1 in '3x+1' problem, or -1 if this never happens.
formula: a(2^k-1) = a(2^(k+1)-1)-1, for odd k>1. - _Joe Slater_, May 17 2018

A006667.name: Number of tripling steps to reach 1 in '3x+1' problem, or -1 if 1 is never reached.
formula: a(1) = 0, a(n) = a(n/2) if n is even, a(n) = a(3n+1)+1 if n>1 is odd. The Collatz conjecture is that this defines a(n) for all n >= 1.

A006668.name: Exponential self-convolution of Pell numbers (divided by 2).

A006669.name: Exponentiation of g.f. for Pell numbers.
formula: a(-1) = 1, a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n, k) * A000129(k) * a(n-k-1). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 11 2017

A006670.name: Edge-distinguishing chromatic number of path with n nodes.
formula: For n > 2, if either r is odd, and r^2 - 2*r + 5 < 2*n <= r^2 + r + 2, or r is even, and r^2 - r + 2 < 2 * n <= r^2 + 2, then a(n) = r [From Al-Wahabi, et al.]. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 14 2017

A006671.name: Edge-distinguishing chromatic number of cycle with n nodes.
formula: If either r is odd, and r^2 - 2*r + 1 < 2*n <= r^2 + r, or r is even, and r^2 - r < 2 * n <= r^2, then a(n) = r [From Al-Wahabi, et al.].

A006673.name: E.g.f. is the logarithmic derivative of e.g.f. for Pell numbers [1, 0, 1, 2, 5, ...].
formula: G.f.: 1-2/Q(0) where Q(k) = 1 + 1/(1 + 2*(k+1)/(-1/x +(2*k+2)/Q(k+1))); (continued fraction, 3-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 23 2012
G.f.: -1/Q(0), where Q(k) = 2*k+2 - 1/x + (k+1)*(k+2)/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Apr 15 2013
G.f.: 1/Q(0), where Q(k)= 1/(x*(k+1)) - 2 + 1/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 07 2013
G.f.: x/Q(0), m=-2, where Q(k) = 1 - 2*x*(2*k+1) - m*x^2*(k+1)*(2*k+1)/( 1 - 2*x*(2*k+2) - m*x^2*(k+1)*(2*k+3)/Q(k+1) ) ; (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 24 2013
E.g.f.: 2*x/Q(0), where Q(k) = 8*k+2 - 2*x/(1 + 2*x/(4*k+3 - 2*x/(1 + 2*x/Q(k+1) ))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 19 2013
E.g.f.: sqrt(2)/(sqrt(2) - tanh(sqrt(2)*x)) -1 = W(0) -1, where W(k) = 1 + x/(4*k+1 - 1*x/(1 + 2*x/(4*k+3 - 2*x/W(k+1) ))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 18 2014

a(n) ~ (-2) cos((n+1)*t) R^(-(n+1)) n!, where t = arctan(y/x) and R = sqrt(x^2+y^2), where x = log(3+2*sqrt(2))/(2*sqrt(2)) and y = Pi/(2*sqrt(2)) (note that R is approximately 1.274 and t is approximately 1.012*Pi/3). This formula follows from the standard techniques of analytic combinatorics (see the Flajolet and Sedgewick reference). - _Justin M. Troyka_, Jun 20 2019
a(n+1) = 2*a(n) - Sum_{k=1..n-1} binomial(n,k) * a(k) * a(n-k) if n>=1. - _Michael Somos_, Apr 22 2020

A006674.name: Triangulations of a square with no separating triangles (previously "Bordered triangulations of sphere with n nodes").

A006675.name: Number of paths through an array.

A006676.name: Number of paths through an array.
formula: a(n) = - Sum_{k=3..n} binomial(k, 3) * s(n+1, n+1-k) * n^(n-k) where s(n, k) are Stirling numbers of the first kind. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 16 2017

A006677.name: Number of planted binary phylogenetic trees with n labels.
formula: E.g.f.: exp(x)/(3 - 2*exp(x))^(1/2). This sequence is the Stirling transform of the sequence ( (2n-1)!! + n(2n-3)!! )_(n >= 0) = (1, 2, 5, 24, 165, 1470, 16065, 207900, ...) with e.g.f. (1+x)/(1-2*x)^(1/2). (Both remarks assume offset 0.) - _David Callan_, Jul 22 2008
a(n) ~ sqrt(3) * n! / (2*sqrt(Pi) * n^(3/2) * (log(3/2))^(n-1/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 15 2015
Recurrence: a(1) = 1, a(n) = 1 + Sum_{0<k<n} binomial(n-1,k)*a(k)*a(n-k). - _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Nov 14 2016
E.g.f. A(x) = y satisfies 0 = 1 - exp(x) + y - y^2/2 and (1 - y)*y' = exp(x). - _Michael Somos_, Nov 16 2016

A006678.name: Number of planted binary phylogenetic trees with n labels.
formula: E.g.f.: -(-1+(1-2*x-2*x^2)^(1/2))/(1+x), Simon Plouffe in his Master's Thesis, Uqam 1992.
a(n) ~ sqrt(6-2*sqrt(3)) * (1+sqrt(3))^(n-1) * n^(n-1) / exp(n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 01 2013

A006679.name: Number of planted binary phylogenetic trees with n labels.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{j=0..n} C(n,j)*(-1)^(n-j)* Sum_{k=1..j} 2^(1-k)*(2*k-2)!/ (k-1)!* Sum_{i=0..j} stirling2(i,k)*k^(j-i)*C(j,i). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Nov 17 2015
a(n) ~ sqrt(3-sqrt(3)) * n^(n-1) / (log((1+sqrt(3))/2)^(n-1/2) * exp(n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 29 2015

A006680.name: Number of binary phylogenetic trees with n labels.

A006681.name: Number of binary phylogenetic trees with n labels.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=2..n} S(n, k) * A001147(k - 2) where S(n, m) are the Stirling numbers of the second kind. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 16 2017

A006682.name: Number of binary phylogenetic trees with n labels.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=2..n} S(n, k) * A006680(k) where S(n, k) are Stirling numbers of the second kind. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 16 2017

A006683.name: Number of regions in certain maps.

A006686.name: Octavan primes: primes of the form p = x^8 + y^8.

A006688.name: Number of self-dual equivalence classes switching functions of exactly n+1 variables.

A006689.name: Number of deterministic, completely-defined, initially-connected finite automata with 2 inputs and n unlabeled states.
formula: For k = 2, a(n) = Sum (Product_{i=1..n-1} i^(f_i - f_{i-1} - 1)) * n^(n*k - f_{n-1} - 1), where the sum is taken over integers f_1, ..., f_{n-1} satisfying 0 <= f_1 < k and f_{i-1} < f_{i} < i*k for i = 2..n-1. - _Nelma Moreira_, Jul 31 2005 [Typo corrected by _Petros Hadjicostas_, Feb 26 2021. See Theorem 8 in Almeida, Moreira, and Reis (2007). The value of f_0 is not relevant.]

A006690.name: Number of deterministic, completely-defined, initially-connected finite automata with 3 inputs and n unlabeled states.
formula: For k = 3, a(n) = Sum (Product_{i=1..n-1} i^(f_i - f_{i-1} - 1))) * n^(n*k - f_{n-1} - 1), where the sum is taken over integers f_1, ..., f_{n-1} satisfying 0 <= f_1 < k and f_{i-1} < f_{i} < i*k for i = 2..n-1. - _Nelma Moreira_, Jul 31 2005 [Typo corrected by _Petros Hadjicostas_, Mar 06 2021. See Theorem 8 in Almeida, Moreira, and Reis (2007). The value of f_0 is not relevant.]

A006691.name: Normalized number of connected (n+1)-state finite automata with 2 inputs.

A006692.name: Number of connected n-state finite automata with 3 inputs.

A006693.name: Modified Engel expansion of 3/7.
formula: a(n) = floor(1/A(n)) where A(1) = 3/7, A(n+1) = (1/a(n) - A(n)) * (a(n) + 1). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 17 2017

A006694.name: Number of cyclotomic cosets of 2 mod 2n+1.
formula: Conjecture: a((3^n-1)/2) = n. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 26 2008 [This is correct.
2*((3^n-1)/2) + 1 = 3^n and the polynomial (x^(3^n) - 1) / (x - 1) factors over GF(2) into Prod_{k=0}^{n-1} x^(2*3^k) + x^(3^k) + 1. - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 01 2019]
2) The only case when A006694(n) < A037226(n) is n=0;
3) If {C_i}, i=1..A006694(n), is the set of all cyclotomic cosets of 2 mod (2n+1), then lcm(|C_1|, ..., |C_{A006694(n)}|) = A002326(n). (End)

A006697.name: Number of subwords of length n in infinite word generated by a -> aab, b -> b.
formula: Conjectures: partial sums of A103354, also equal to A094913(n) + 1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 19 2005

a(n) = sum(k=0,n,min(2^k,n-k+1)) = 2^(m+1)-1 + (n-m)(n-m+1)/2 with m = [ n+1-LambertW( 2^(n+1) * log(2) ) / log(2) ] = integer part of the solution to 2^m = n+1-m. (conjectured). - _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 14 2007

A006698.name: T(2,2n), where T(k,m) is the number of sequences a_1,...,a_m of integers 0,1,...,n with n=floor(m/k) such that the 'bumped' sequence b_1,...,b_m has exactly k of each of 0,...,n-1, where b_i=a_i + j (mod n+1) with minimal j>=0 such that b_0,...,b_i contain at most k elements equal to b_i.

A006699.name: T(3,3n), where T(k,m) is the number of sequences a_1,...,a_m of integers 0,1,...,n with n=floor(m/k) such that the 'bumped' sequence b_1,...,b_m has exactly k of each of 0,...,n-1, where b_i=a_i + j (mod n+1) with minimal j>=0 such that b_0,...,b_i contain at most k elements equal to b_i.

A006700.name: T(n,3,1), where T(n,k,s) with 0<=s<n is the number of sequences a_1,...,a_(k*n+s) of integers 0,1,...,n such that the 'bumped' sequence b_1,...,b_(k*n+s) has exactly s n's, where b_i=a_i + j (mod n+1) with minimal j>=0 such that b_0,...,b_i contain at most k elements equal to b_i.

A006701.name: Exponentiation of g.f. for Fibonacci numbers.
formula: a(-1) = 1, a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} binomial(n, k) * A000045(k) * a(n-k-1). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jun 11 2017

A006702.name: Solution to a Pellian equation: least x such that x^2 - n y^2 = +- 1.

A006703.name: Solution to Pellian: y such that x^2 - n*y^2 = +-1.

A006704.name: Solution to Pellian: x such that x^2 - n y^2 = +- 1, +- 4.

A006705.name: Solution to Pellian: y such that x^2 - n y^2 = +- 1, +- 4.

A006706.name: Self-convolution of numbers of trees on n nodes.

A006708.name: Expansion of a modular function for gamma_0(6).

A006709.name: Expansion of a modular function.
formula: Expansion of ((1/q) * f(-q, -q^2)^2 * f(q, q^2) / psi(q^3)^3)^2 in powers of q where psi(), f(,) are Ramanujan theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 18 2015
Expansion of (eta(q) * eta(q^2))^2 * (eta(q^3)^10 / eta(q^6)^14) in powers of q. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 22 2005
Euler transform of period 6 sequence [ -2, -4, -12, -4, -2, 0, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 22 2005

A006710.name: Expansion of eta(q^10)^12/(eta(q^2)^4*eta(q^5)^8) in powers of q.
formula: Euler transform of period 10 sequence [0, 4, 0, 4, 8, 4, 0, 4, 0, 0, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 10 2005

A006711.name: Describe previous term from the right (method A - initial term is 1).

A006712.name: Number of 3-edge-colored trivalent graphs with 2n labeled nodes.

A006713.name: Number of 3-edge-colored connected trivalent graphs with 2n labeled nodes.

A006714.name: Number of trivalent bipartite labeled graphs with 2n labeled nodes.
formula: a(n) = A246599(n) + Sum_{k=1..n-1} binomial(2*n-1,2*k-1)*A246599(k)*a(n-k). - _Andrew Howroyd_, May 22 2018

A006715.name: Describe the previous term! (method A - initial term is 3).

A006717.name: Number of ways of arranging 2n+1 nonattacking semi-queens on a (2n+1) X (2n+1) toroidal board.
formula: Suppose n is odd and let b(n)=a((n-1)/2). Then b(n) is odd; if n>3 and n is not 1 mod 3 then b(n) is divisible by 3n; b(n)=-2n mod n^2 in n is prime; b(n) is divisible by n^2 if n is composite; b(n) is asymptotically in between 3.2^n and 0.62^n n!. [Cavenagh, Wanless], [McKay, McLeod, Wanless], [Stones, Wanless] - _Ian Wanless_, Jul 30 2010
b(n) is asymptotic to n!/e [Eberhard, Manners, Mrazovic]. - _Sam Spiro_, Apr 16 2019

A006718.name: Number of golygons of length 8n.
formula: a(n) = 4 * A007219(n) for n > 0. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 29 2012

A006720.name: Somos-4 sequence: a(0)=a(1)=a(2)=a(3)=1; for n >= 4, a(n) = (a(n-1) * a(n-3) + a(n-2)^2) / a(n-4).
formula: a(n+1)/a(n) seems to be asymptotic to C^n with C=1.226....... - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 07 2002. Confirmed by Hone - see below.

The terms of the sequence have the leading order asymptotics log a(n) ~ D n^2 with D = zeta(w1)*k^2/(2*w1)-log|sigma(k)| = 0.10222281... where zeta and sigma are the Weierstrass functions with invariants g2 = 4, g3 = -1, w1 = 1.496729323 is the real half-period of the corresponding elliptic curve, k = -1.134273216 as above. This agrees with Benoit Cloitre's numerical result with C = exp(2D) = 1.2268447... - _Andrew Hone_, Feb 09 2005

a(n) = (a(n-1)*a(n-3) + a(n-2)^2)/a(n-4); a(0) = a(1) = a(2) = a(3) = 1; exact formula is a(n) = A*B^n*sigma (z_0+nk)/(sigma (k))^(n^2), where sigma is the Weierstrass sigma function associated to the elliptic curve y^2 = 4*x^3-4*x+1, A = 1/sigma(z_0) = 0.112724016-0.824911687*i, B = sigma(k)*sigma (z_0)/sigma (z_0+k) = 0.215971963+0.616028193*i, k = 1.859185431, z_0 = 0.204680500+1.225694691*i, sigma(k) = 1.555836426, all to 9 decimal places. This is a special case of a general formula for 4th order bilinear recurrences. The Somos-4 sequence corresponds to the sequence of points (2n-3)P on the curve, where P = (0, 1). - _Andrew Hone_, Oct 12 2005

A006721.name: Somos-5 sequence: a(n) = (a(n-1) * a(n-4) + a(n-2) * a(n-3)) / a(n-5), with a(0) = a(1) = a(2) = a(3) = a(4) = 1.
formula: Comments from _Andrew Hone_, Aug 24 2004: "Both the even terms b(n)=a(2n) and odd terms b(n)=a(2n+1) satisfy the fourth order recurrence b(n)=(b(n-1)*b(n-3)+8*b(n-2)^2)/b(n-4).

"Hence the general formula is a(2n)=A*B^n*sigma(c+n*k)/sigma(k)^(n^2), a(2n+1)=D*E^n*sigma(f+n*k)/sigma(k)^(n^2) where sigma is the Weierstrass sigma function associated to the elliptic curve y^2=4*x^3-(121/12)*x+845/216 (this is birationally equivalent to the minimal model V^2+U*V+6*V=U^3+7*U^2+12*U given by van der Poorten).

A006722.name: Somos-6 sequence: a(n) = (a(n-1) * a(n-5) + a(n-2) * a(n-4) + a(n-3)^2) / a(n-6), a(0) = ... = a(5) = 1.
formula: Michael Somos found an explicit formula for a(n) in 1993, which is not as widely known as it should be. The following is a quotation from the "Somos 6 sequence" document mentioned in the Links section: (Start)

This sequence is one of a large class of sequences of numbers that satisfy a non-linear recurrence relation depending on previous terms. It is also one of the class of sequences which can be computed from a theta series, hence I call them theta sequences. Here are the details:

Consider the doubly indexed series: f(x,y) = c1*c2^(x*y)*sum(k2, (-1)^k2*sum(k1, g(k1,k2,x,y))) , where g(k1,k2,x,y) = c3^(k1*k1)*c4^(k2*k2)*c5^(k1*k2)*cos(c6*k1*x+c7*k2*y) . Here both sums range over all integers.
Then the sequence defined by a(n) = f(n-2.5,n-2.5) is the Somos 6 sequence. I announced this in 1993. (End) - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 06 2015
From _Andrew Hone_ and Yuri Fedorov, Nov 27 2015: (Start)
The following is an exact formula for a(n):
C = i/sqrt(20) (with i the imaginary unit),
sigma is the two-variable Kleinian sigma-function associated with the genus two curve X: y^2 = 4*x^5 - 233*x^4 + 1624*x^3 - 422*x^2 + 36*x - 1, and

v and v_0 are two-component vectors in the Jacobian of X, being the images under the Abel map of the divisors P_1+P_2 - 2*infinity,  Q_1 + Q_2 - 2*infinity, respectively, where points P_j and Q_j on X are given by
The Abel map is based at infinity and calculated with respect to the basis of holomorphic differentials dx/y, x dx/y.

A006723.name: Somos-7 sequence: a(n) = (a(n-1) * a(n-6) + a(n-2) * a(n-5) + a(n-3) * a(n-4)) / a(n-7), a(0) = ... = a(6) = 1.
formula: a(6 - n) = a(n) for all n in Z.

A006752.name: Decimal expansion of Catalan's constant 1 - 1/9 + 1/25 - 1/49 + 1/81 - ...
formula: c = integrate(x=0..1, 3*arctan(x*(1-x)/(2-x))/x ). - Posting to Number Theory List by James McLaughlin, Sep 27 2007
c = (zeta(2,1/4)- zeta(2,3/4))/16. - _Gerry Martens_, May 27 2011 [With the Hurwitz Zeta function zeta.]
c = phi(-1, 2, 1/2)/4, where phi is Lerch transcendent. - _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 28 2013
c = 1/2*integrate(x=0..Pi/2, log(cot(x)+csc(x)) ). - _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 11 2013 [see the Adamchik link]
c = - integrate(x=0..1,(log x)/(1+x^2)) = integrate(x=1..oo,(log x)/(1+x^2)). - _Clark Kimberling_, Nov 04 2016

c = (Zeta(2, 1/4) - Pi^2)/8 = (Psi(1, 1/4) - Pi^2)/8, with the Hurwitz Zeta function and the trigamma function Psi(1, z). For the partial sums of the series given in the name see A294970/A294971. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 15 2017

formula: a(n) = (a(n-1) * a(n-3) + a(n-2)^2) / a(n-4) for all n in Z except n=4.
a(n) = (-a(n-1) * a(n-4) - a(n-2) * a(n-3)) / a(n-5) for all n in Z except n=5.
a(-n) = -a(n) for all n in Z.

A006784.name: Engel expansion of Pi.
formula: Definition of Engel expansion: For a positive real number x (here Pi), define 1 <= a(1) <= a(2) <= a(3) <= ... so that x = 1/a(1) + 1/a(1)a(2) + 1/a(1)a(2)a(3) + ... by x(1)=x, a(n) = ceiling(1/x(n)), x(n+1) = x(n)a(n)-1. Expansion always exists and is unique. See references for more information.

A006785.name: Number of triangle-free graphs on n vertices.
formula: Erdős, Kleitman, & Rothschild prove that a(n) = 2^(n^2/4 + o(n^2)) and a(n) = (1 + o(1/n))*A033995(n). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 01 2018

A006786.name: Number of squarefree graphs on n vertices.

A006787.name: Number of n-node graphs with no cycles of length less than 5.

A006789.name: Bessel numbers: the number of nonoverlapping partitions of an n-set into equivalence classes.
formula: G.f.: 1 / (1 - x - x^2 / (1 - 2*x - x^2 / (1 - 3*x - x^2 / ...))) (a continued fraction). - _Michael Somos_, Oct 06 2003
G.f.: 1/(U(0)-1) + 1/x^2 where U(k)= 1 - x*(k+1) + x/(1 + x/U(k+1)) ; (continued fraction, 2-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 13 2012
G.f.: T(0)/(1-x), where T(k) = 1 - x^2/( x^2 - (1-x*(k+1))*(1-x*(k+2))/T(k+1) ); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 02 2013
a(n) ~ Sum_{k>=0} k^(n+2)/(k!)^2 = A086880(n+2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 24 2014
