A006841.name: Permutation arrays of period n.
formula: Asymptotic behavior: The n-th term T(n) is always larger than n! / (8*n^2) = (n-1)! / 8n; for large n, it is approximated by that value. Stated as formula: T(n) > (n-1)! / 8n; lim 8n * T(n) / (n-1) = 1 as n tends to infinity.

A006842.name: Triangle read by rows: row n gives numerators of Farey series of order n.

A006843.name: Triangle read by rows: row n gives denominators of Farey series of order n.

A006844.name: a(1)=4, a(2)=5; thereafter a(n) is smallest number that is greater than a(n-1) and having a unique representation as a(j) + a(k) for j<k.

A006846.name: Hammersley's polynomial p_n(1).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k>=0} (-1)^(n+k)*A065547(n, k) = Sum_{k>=0} A085707(n, k). - _Philippe Deléham_, Feb 26 2004
E.g.f.: cosh(sqrt(3)*x/2)/cos(x/2) = Sum_{n>=0} a(n)*x^(2n)/(2n)!. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 27 2005

A006847.name: Number of extreme points of the set of n X n symmetric doubly-stochastic matrices.
formula: A recurrence for this sequence is a(n) = a(n-1) + (n-1)^2*a(n-2) - ((n-1)*(n-2)/2)*a(n-3) - (n-1)*(n-2)*(n-3)*a(n-4). This is given in Stanley, 1980, p. 180, except that there is a typographical error in Stanley's formula (corrected here). - _Jeffrey Shallit_, Dec 05 2009

A006848.name: Number of extreme points of the set of n X n symmetric doubly-substochastic matrices.
formula: The lgdegf is (2+x+x^4+x^5-2*x^3-2*x^2)/(x-1)^2/(x+1)^2, conjectured in Simon Plouffe's Master's Thesis, Uqam 1992. Lgdegf is the logarithmic derivative of f(x), the g.f. is exponential.

A006849.name: Number of strongly self-dual planar maps with 2n edges.

A006850.name: Exponential self-convolution of numbers of rooted trees on n nodes.

A006851.name: Trails of length n on honeycomb lattice.

A006852.name: Step at which n is expelled in Kimberling's puzzle (A035486).
formula: a(n) >= floor((n+4)/3), n is expulsed from the unshuffled zone. - _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Feb 25 2010

A006853.name: Balanced colorings of n-cube.
formula: For n > 0, a(n) = N(n,2^(n-1)) + 2 * Sum_{k=1..2^(n-1)-1} N(n, 2*k) where N(n,2k) = Sum_{(j)} N((j))^n * (-1)^c((j)) / h((j)) is the sum over all partitions (j) = (j[1],...,j[2k]) of 2*k (i.e., 2*k = Sum_{i=1..2*k} i*j[i]) and N((j)) is the coefficient of x^k in Product_{i=1..2*k} (1+x^i)^{j[i]}, c((j)) = Sum_{i} j[2*i], and h((j)) = Product_{i} j[i]! * i^{j[i]} [From Palmer et al.]. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 15 2017

A006854.name: Nonantipodal balanced colorings of n-cube.
formula: For n > 1, a(n) = Sum_{k=0..2^(n-2)} A(n,2*k) where A(n,2*k) = N(n,2*k) - Sum_{i=0..k-1} binomial(2^(n-1)-2*i, k-i) * A(n,2*i) with N(n,2*k) as defined in A006853 [From Palmer et al.]. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Aug 16 2017

A006855.name: Maximal edges in n-node squarefree graph.

A006856.name: Maximal number of edges in n-node graph of girth at least 5.

A006857.name: a(n) = binomial(n+5,5) * binomial(n+5,4)/(n+5).
formula: Numerator polynomial of the g.f is the fourth row polynomial of the Narayana triangle. (End)

A006858.name: Expansion of x*(1 + x)*(1 + 6*x + x^2)/(1 - x)^7.

A006860.name: Erroneous version of A223911: Tiered orders on n nodes.

A006861.name: Number of directed site animals on hexagonal lattice.

A006862.name: Euclid numbers: 1 + product of the first n primes.

A006863.name: Denominator of B_{2n}/(-4n), where B_m are the Bernoulli numbers.
formula: B_{2k}/(4k) = -(1/2)*zeta(1-2k). For n > 0, a(n) = gcd k^L (k^{2n}-1) where k ranges over all the integers and L is as large as necessary.
Product of 2^{a+2} (where 2^a exactly divides 2*n) and p^{a+1} (where p is an odd prime such that p-1 divides 2*n and p^a exactly divides 2*n). - _Peter J. Cameron_, Mar 25 2002

A006864.name: Number of Hamiltonian cycles in P_4 X P_n.
formula: a(n)=sum ( sum ( binomial(k,j) * sum (binomial(j, i-j)*2^j *binomial(k-j,n-i-3*(k-j))*(-2)^(4*(k-j)-(n-i)), i,j,n-k+j) , j,0,k) , k,1,n ), n>0. - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 04 2010

A006865.name: Number of Hamiltonian cycles in P_5 X P_{2n}: a(n) = 11a(n-1)+2a(n-3).

A006866.name: Number of irreducible polyhedral graphs with n nodes.

A006867.name: Number of irreducible polyhedral graphs with n faces.

A006868.name: Number of minimal 3-polyhedra with n edges.

A006869.name: Vertex-degree sequences of n-faced polyhedral graphs.

A006870.name: Number of quasi-orders with n elements.

A006871.name: Exponentiation of g.f. for rooted trees.

A006872.name: Numbers n such that phi(n) = phi(sigma(n)).

A006873.name: Number of alternating 4-signed permutations.
formula: E.g.f.: (sin(x) + cos(3*x)) / cos(4*x). - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 28 2013
a(n) ~ sqrt(2-sqrt(2)) * 2^(3*n+3/2) * n^(n+1/2) / (Pi^(n+1/2) * exp(n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 25 2014

A006874.name: Mu-atoms of period n on continent of Mandelbrot set.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{ d divides n, d<n} phi(n/d)*a(d), n>1, a(1)=1, where phi is Euler totient function (A000010). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 09 2002
a(1)=1; for n > 1, a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n-1} a(gcd(n,k)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 25 2009
G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = x + Sum_{k>=2} phi(k) * A(x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 04 2019

A006875.name: Non-seed mu-atoms of period n in Mandelbrot set.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d < n} (phi(n/d) * sum_{c|d} (mu(d/c) 2^(c-1))), where phi(n) and mu(n) are the Euler totient function (A000010) and Moebius function (A008683), respectively. - _Cheng Zhang_, Apr 03 2012

A006876.name: Mu-molecules in Mandelbrot set whose seeds have period n.
formula: a(n) = 2*l(n) - sum_{d|n} phi(n/d)*l(d), where l(n) = sum_{d|n} mu(n/d) 2^(d-1) (A000740), and phi(n) and mu(n) are the Euler totient function (A000010) and Moebius function (A008683), respectively. - Cheng Zhang, Apr 02 2012

A006877.name: In the '3x+1' problem, these values for the starting value set new records for number of steps to reach 1.

A006878.name: Record number of steps to reach 1 in `3x+1' problem, corresponding to starting values in A006877.

A006879.name: Number of primes with n digits.

A006881.name: Squarefree semiprimes: Numbers that are the product of two distinct primes.
formula: a(n) ~ n log n/log log n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 22 2013

A006882.name: Double factorials n!!: a(n) = n*a(n-2) for n > 1, a(0) = a(1) = 1.
formula: a(n) ~ c * n^((n+1)/2) / exp(n/2), where c = sqrt(Pi) if n is even, and c = sqrt(2) if n is odd. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 08 2014

a(n) = 2^h*(2/Pi)^(sin(Pi*h)^2/2)*Gamma(h+1) where h = n/2. This analytical extension supports the view that a(-1) = 1 is a meaningful numerical extension. With this definition (-1/2)!! = Gamma(3/4)/Pi^(1/4). - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 24 2019

A006883.name: Long period primes: the decimal expansion of 1/p has period p-1.
formula: Emil Artin conjectured that the proportion of primes that belong to this sequence can be expressed as:
This Artin's constant, Product_{p prime} (1-1/(p^2-p)), is referenced in A005596. - _Robert FERREOL_, Jun 05 2018

A006884.name: In the '3x+1' problem, these values for the starting value set new records for highest point of trajectory before reaching 1.

A006885.name: Record highest point of trajectory before reaching 1 in '3x+1' problem, corresponding to starting values in A006884.

A006886.name: Kaprekar numbers: positive numbers n such that n = q+r and n^2 = q*10^m+r, for some m >= 1, q >= 0 and 0 <= r < 10^m, with n != 10^a, a >= 1.
formula: a(n) = A194218(n) + A194219(n) and A194218(n) concatenated with A194219(n) gives a(n)^2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 19 2011

A006887.name: Kaprekar triples: q such that q = x + y + z and q^3 = x*10^2n + y*10^n + z, where z < 10^n and n is the number of digits in q. q is not a power of 10 (except q=1).

A006888.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-2)*a(n-3) for n > 2 with a(0) = a(1) = a(2) = 1.
formula: Lim n->inf a(n)/(a(n-1)*a(n-5)) = 1 agrees with lim n->inf a(n) = c^(P^n) (c=1.60119..., P=PisotV) since PisotV is real root of x^3-x-1 and thus a root of x^5-x^4-1 because x^5-x^4-1 = (x^3-x-1)*(x^2-x+1) and c^(P^n)/(c^(P^(n-1)*c^(P^(n-5)) = c^(P^(n-5)*(P^5-P^4-1)). - _Gerald McGarvey_, Aug 14 2004

A006889.name: Exponent of least power of 2 having n consecutive 0's in its decimal representation.

A006890.name: Decimal expansion of Feigenbaum bifurcation velocity.

A006891.name: Decimal expansion of Feigenbaum reduction parameter.

A006892.name: Representation as a sum of squares requires n squares with greedy algorithm.
formula: For n >= 4, a(n) = a(n-1) + ((a(n-1)+1)/2)^2. - Joe K. Crump (joecr(AT)carolina.rr.com), Apr 16 2000
a(n) = n for n <= 3; for n > 3, a(n) = ((a(n-1)+3)/2)^2 - 2. - _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Mar 30 2013

A006893.name: Smallest number whose representation requires n triangular numbers with greedy algorithm; also number of 1-2 rooted trees of height n.
formula: a(0) = 1, a(n) = sum(i=0..n-1, t(a(i)), where t(n)=n*(n+1)/2. - _Jon Perry_, Feb 14 2004

A006894.name: Number of planted 3-trees of height < n.
formula: Partial sums of A002658; a(n+1) = a(n)(a(n)+1)/2 + 1 (from Marc LeBrun).

A006895.name: Parenthesized one way gives the powers of 2: (1), (2), (1+3), ..., another way the powers of 3: (1), (2+1), (3+6), ....

A006896.name: a(n) is the number of hierarchical linear models on n labeled factors allowing 2-way interactions (but no higher order interactions); or the number of simple labeled graphs with nodes chosen from an n-set.
formula: E.g.f.: exp(x)*A(x) where A(x) is e.g.f. for A006125. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 11 2012.

A006897.name: a(n) is the number of hierarchical linear models on n unlabeled factors allowing 2-way interactions (but no higher order interactions); or the number of unlabeled simple graphs with <= n nodes.
formula: O.g.f.: A(x)/(1-x), where A(x) is o.g.f. for A000088. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 12 2012

A006900.name: Log of g.f. for rooted trees.

A006901.name: Number of caskets of order n.

A006902.name: a(n) = (2n)! * Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k * binomial(n,k) / (n+k)!.
formula: a(n) = B_n(n*0!,(n-1)*1!,...,1*(n-1)!), where B_n(x1,...,xn) is the n-th complete Bell polynomial. - _Max Alekseyev_, Jul 04 2015
a(n) = n!*Z(S_n; n, n-1, ..., 1) where Z(S_n) is the cycle index of the symmetric group of order n. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Nov 14 2017
a(n) = n! * [x^n] exp(-x/(1 - x))/(1 - x)^(n+1). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Nov 21 2017
E.g.f.: exp(1-c(x))/sqrt(1-4*x), where c(x)=(1-sqrt(1-4*x))/(2*x) is the Catalan number generating function. - _Ira M. Gessel_, Jun 04 2021

A006903.name: Number of triangle-free trivalent (or cubic) graphs with 2n labeled nodes.

A006904.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + 2*a(n-2) + (-1)^n.
formula: G.f.: x^4*(-x^2 - x - 1)/((1 + x)^2 (2 x - 1)) [corrected by Harvey P. Dale, Apr 22 2011]
With offset 0: a(n) = 1/9*(7*2^n+(-1)^n*(3*n+2)); if b(1)=1, b(k) = 2*b(k-1)+(-1)^k*k, then for n>4, a(n)=b(n-4). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 28 2002
a[0]=a[1]=1; a[2]=4; a[n]=3a[n-2]+2a[n-3] [From Harvey P. Dale, Apr 22 2011]

A006905.name: Number of transitive relations on n labeled nodes.
formula: E.g.f.: A(x + exp(x) - 1) where A(x) is the e.g.f. for A001035. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jul 28 2014

A006906.name: a(n) is the sum of products of terms in all partitions of n.
formula: The limit of a(n+3)/a(n) is 3. However, the limit of a(n+1)/a(n) does not exist. In fact, the sequence {a(n+1)/a(n)} has three limit points, which are about 1.4422447, 1.4422491 and 1.4422549. (See the Links entry.) - _Dean Hickerson_, Aug 19 2007
G.f.: 1 + Sum_{n>=1} n*x^n / Product_{k=1..n} (1-k*x^k) = 1 + Sum_{n>=1} n*x^n / Product_{k>=n} (1-k*x^k). - _Joerg Arndt_, Mar 23 2011
O.g.f.: exp( Sum_{n>=1} Sum_{k>=1} k^n * x^(n*k) / n ). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 18 2017
O.g.f.: exp( Sum_{n>=1} Sum_{k=1..n} A008292(n,k)*x^(n*k)/(n*(1-x^n)^(n+1)) ), where A008292 is the Eulerian numbers. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 18 2017

A006907.name: Number of zeros in character table of symmetric group S_n.

A006908.name: Number of nonzero elements in the character table of the symmetric group S_n.

A006909.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_10.

A006910.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_11^{min}.

A006911.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_11^{max}.

A006912.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_12^{min}.

A006913.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_12^{mid}.

A006914.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_12^{max}.

A006915.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_13^{min}.

A006916.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_13^{mid}.

A006917.name: Theta series of laminated lattice LAMBDA_13^{max}.

A006918.name: a(n) = binomial(n+3, 3)/4, n odd; n(n+2)(n+4)/24, n even.
formula: a(n+1) = a(n) + binomial(floor(n/2)+2,2), i.e., first differences are A008805. Convolution of A008619 with itself, then shifted right (or A004526 with itself, shifted left by 3). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 27 2006
Linear recurrence: a(n) = 2a(n-1) + a(n-2) - 4a(n-3) + a(n-4) + 2a(n-5) - a(n-6). - _Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Dec 05 2008
Euler transform of length 2 sequence [2, 2]. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 15 2009
a(n+1) + a(n) = A002623(n). - _Johannes W. Meijer_, May 20 2011

A006919.name: Write down all the prime divisors in previous term.

A006920.name: At each step, record how many 1's, 2's, etc. have been seen so far in the sequence.

A006921.name: Diagonals of Pascal's triangle mod 2 interpreted as binary numbers.
formula: a(2*n) = A260022(n); a(2*n+1) = A168081(n+1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 14 2015
a(n) = Sum_{r=0..n/2} (binomial(n-r,r)_{mod 2} * 2^(floor(n/2)-r). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 14 2015

A006922.name: Expansion of 1/eta(q)^24; Fourier coefficients of T_{14}.
formula: a(n) ~ 2*Pi * BesselI(13, 4*Pi*sqrt(n)) / n^(13/2) ~ exp(4*Pi*sqrt(n)) / (sqrt(2)*n^(27/4)) * (1 - 675/(32*Pi*sqrt(n)) + 450225/(2048*Pi^2*n)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2017

A006923.name: Number of connected trivalent graphs with 2n nodes and with girth exactly 3.

A006924.name: Number of connected trivalent graphs with 2n nodes and girth exactly 4.

A006925.name: Number of connected trivalent graphs with 2n nodes and girth exactly 5.

A006926.name: Number of connected trivalent graphs with 2n nodes and girth exactly 6.

A006927.name: Number of connected trivalent graphs with 2n nodes and girth exactly 7.

A006928.name: a(n) = length of (n+1)st run, with initial terms 1, 2.
formula: Essentially same as Kolakoski sequence A000002.

A006930.name: Binomial transform of rooted tree numbers.

A006931.name: Least Carmichael number with n prime factors.

A006932.name: Number of permutations of [n] with at least one strong fixed point (a permutation p of {1,2,...,n} is said to have j as a strong fixed point if p(k) < j for k < j and p(k) > j for k > j).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (n-k)!*A145878(k-1,0). See the link by Theresa Baren, et al. - _Daniel A. McGinnis_, Oct 15 2018

A006935.name: Even pseudoprimes (or primes) to base 2: even n that divide 2^n - 2.

A006936.name: Moebius transform of numbers of preferential arrangements.

A006937.name: Convert the last term from decimal to binary!.

A006938.name: Convert the last term from decimal to binary!

A006939.name: Chernoff sequence: a(n) = Product_{k=1..n} prime(k)^(n-k+1).
formula: a(n) = m(1)*m(2)*m(3)*...*m(n), where m(n) = n-th primorial number. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 20 2005
a(0) = 1, a(n) = a(n - 1)p(n)#, where p(n)# is the n-th primorial (the product of the first n primes). - _Alonso del Arte_, Sep 30 2011
log a(n) = n^2(log n + log log n - 3/2 + o(1))/2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 14 2011
A181796(a(n)) = A000110(n+1). It would be interesting to have a bijective proof of this theorem, which is stated at A181796 without proof. See also A336420. - _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 03 2020

A006942.name: Number of segments used to represent n on calculator display, variant 5: digits '6', '7' and '9' use 6, 3 and 6 segments, respectively.
formula: a(n) = a(floor(n/10)) + a(n mod 10) for n > 9. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 15 2013

a(n) = A010371(n) - A102679(n) + A102681(n) (subtract the number of digits 7 in n) = A277116(n) + A102683(n)  (add number of digits 9 in n); and in particular, A063720(n) <= A277116(n) <= a(n) = A010371(n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 17 2020

A006943.name: Rows of Sierpiński's triangle (Pascal's triangle mod 2).
formula: In the following formulas, [...]_2 means converted to base 2.
From row n, 0 <= n <= 2^k - 1, k >= 0, being
where for k = 0, we get the empty product, i.e., 1, giving a(0) = 1,
we induce from the triangle that row 2^k + n, 0 <= n <= 2^k - 1, is
sum_{n>=0} (-1)^A000120(n)/a(n)^r = Product_{k>=0} (1 - 1/(10^(2^k)+1)^r), where r>0 is a real number.

Note that analogs of Stephan's limit formulas (see Shevelev link) reduce to the relations a(2^t*n+2^(t-1)) = 99*(10^(2^(t-1)+1))/(10^(2^(t-1))-1) * a(2^t*n+2^(t-1)-2), t>=2. In particular, for t=2,3,4, we have the following formulas:
a(n) = Product_{b_j != 0}a(2^j) where n = Sum_{j>=0}b_j*2^j is the binary representation of n.

A006944.name: Number of letters in the n-th ordinal number (in American English).

A006945.name: Smallest odd number that requires n Miller-Rabin primality tests.
formula: Bach shows that, on the ERH, a(n) >> exp(sqrt(1/2 * x log x)). [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 17, 2011]

A006946.name: Independence number of De Bruijn graph of order n on two symbols.

A006949.name: A well-behaved cousin of the Hofstadter sequence: a(n) = a(n - 1 - a(n-1)) + a(n - 2 - a(n-2)) for n > 2 with a(0) = a(1) = a(2) = 1.
formula: a(n) = a(n-1) + 0 or 1 for n > 0 and lim_{n -> infinity} a(n)/n = 1/2. - Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)lycos.com), Jun 27 2003
G.f.: z + z * Sum_{n >= 1} Product_{k=1..n} (z + z^(2^k)). - _Frank Ruskey_ and Chris Deugau (deugaucj(AT)uvic.ca)
For an efficient way to compute this sequence for large n, see A120511.

A006950.name: G.f.: Product_{k>=1} (1 + x^(2*k - 1)) / (1 - x^(2*k)).
formula: G.f.: 1/Sum_{k>=0} (-x)^(k*(k+1)/2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 22 2002 [corrected by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 17 2015]
Expansion of 1 / psi(-x) in powers of x where psi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of q^(1/8) * eta(q^2) / (eta(q) * eta(q^4)) in powers of q.
Convolution inverse of A106459. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 02 2005
G.f.: exp( Sum_{n>=1} [Sum_{d|n} (-1)^(n-d)*d] * x^n/n ). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 22 2009

a(n) ~ (8*n+1) * cosh(sqrt(8*n-1)*Pi/4) / (16*sqrt(2)*n^2) - sinh(sqrt(8*n-1)*Pi/4) / (2*Pi*n^(3/2)) ~ exp(Pi*sqrt(n/2))/(4*sqrt(2)*n) * (1 - (2/Pi + Pi/16)/sqrt(2*n) + (3/16 + Pi^2/1024)/n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 17 2015, extended Jan 09 2017
Can be computed recursively by Sum_{j>=0} (-1)^(ceiling(j/2)) a(n - j(j+1)/2) = 0, for n > 0. [Merca, Theorem 4.3] - _Eric M. Schmidt_, Sep 21 2017
a(n) = A000041(n) - A085642(n), for n >= 1. - _Wouter Meeussen_, Dec 20 2017

A006951.name: Number of conjugacy classes in GL(n,2).
formula: The number a(n) of conjugacy classes in the group GL(n, q) is the coefficient of t^n in prod(k>=1, (1-t^k)/(1-q*t^k) ). - Noam Katz (noamkj(AT)hotmail.com), Mar 30 2001.
Euler transform of A008965. - _Christian G. Bower_, Jan 29 2004
G.f.: exp(Sum_{k>=1} ( Sum_{d|k} d*(2^(k/d) - 1) ) * x^k/k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 27 2018

A006952.name: Number of conjugacy classes in GL(n,3).
formula: The number a(n) of conjugacy classes in the group GL(n, q) is the coefficient of t^n in prod(k>=1, (1-t^k)/(1-q*t^k) ). - Noam Katz (noamkj(AT)hotmail.com), Mar 30 2001.
G.f.: exp(Sum_{k>=1} ( Sum_{d|k} d*(3^(k/d) - 1) ) * x^k/k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 27 2018

A006953.name: a(n) = denominator of Bernoulli(2n)/(2n).
formula: G.f. for Bernoulli(2*n)/(2*n) = A001067(n)/A006953(n): (-1)^n/((2*Pi)^(2*n)*(2*n)) * Integral_{t=0..1} log(1-1/t)^(2*n) dt. - _Gerry Martens_, May 18 2011

A006954.name: Denominators of Bernoulli numbers B_0, B_1, B_2, B_4, B_6, ...

A006955.name: Denominator of (2n+1) B_{2n}, where B_n are the Bernoulli numbers.
formula: Apparently a(n) = denominator(Sum_{k=0..2*n-1} (-1)^(2*n-k+1)*E1(2*n, k+1)/ binomial(2*n, k+1)), where E1(n, k) denotes the first-order Eulerian numbers A123125. - _Peter Luschny_, Feb 17 2021

A006956.name: Denominator of (2n+1)(2n+2) B_{2n}, where B_n are the Bernoulli numbers. Also denominators of the asymptotic expansion of the polygamma function psi'''(z).

A006957.name: Self-convolution of numbers of preferential arrangements.
formula: G.f.: (Sum_{j>=0} j!*x^j / Product_{k=1..j} (1 - k*x))^2. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Apr 06 2019

A006958.name: Number of parallelogram polyominoes with n cells (also called staircase polyominoes, although that term is overused).
formula: The continued fraction given by P. Flajolet, "Polya Festoons", is derived from a q-expansion, C(x, y;q), where C(1, 1;q) = q/(1-2*q-q^3/(1-2*q^2-q^5/(1-2*q^3-q^7/(1-2*q^4-q^9/(1-...))))) = q + 2*q^2 + 4*q^3 + 9*q^4 + 20*q^5 + 46*q^6 + 105*q^7 + ... - _Paul D. Hanna_, May 14 2005
G.f.: 1/x/G(0) -1/x, where G(k)= 1 - x^(k+1)/(1 - x^(k+1)/G(k+1) ); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Jun 29 2013
G.f.: W(0)/x - 1/x, where W(k) = 1 - x^(k+1)/( x^(k+1) - 1/(1 - x^(k+1)/( x^(k+1) - 1/W(k+1) ))); R=1 (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Aug 27 2013

O.g.f. as a ratio of q-series: 1 + A(q) = N(q)/D(q) = 1 + q + 2*q^2 + 4*q^3 + ..., where N(q) = Sum_{n >= 0} (-1)^n*q^((n^2 + 3*n)/2)/Product_{k = 1..n} (1 - q^k)^2 and D(q) = Sum_{n >= 0} (-1)^n*q^((n^2 + n)/2)/Product_{k = 1..n} (1 - q^k)^2.
The constant d = 2.30913... in the above asymptotic formula is a zero of D(q) (as is 1/d).
Continued fraction representations for the o.g.f.:

A006959.name: Number of labeled M-type rooted trees on n nodes.
formula: a(n) ~ n^(n-1) * sqrt(1 + (1+log(1-r))/((1-r)*(2+log(1-r))^2)) / (exp(n) * r^(n-1/2)), where r = 0.1520268451233936874315... is the root of the equation 2 + log(1-r) = exp(1+r-1/(2+log(1-r))). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 08 2014

A006960.name: Reverse and Add! sequence starting with 196.

A006961.name: Number of mappings from n points to themselves with in-degree <= 2.
formula: Let T(x) = x+x^2+x^3+2*x^4+3*x^5+6*x^6+11*x^7+ ... be the g.f. for A001190. Then the g.f. here is 1/(Prod_{k=1..oo} (1-T(x^k))). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 25 2014

A006962.name: Supersingular primes of the elliptic curve X_0 (11).

A006963.name: Number of planar embedded labeled trees with n nodes: (2n-3)!/(n-1)! for n >= 2, a(1) = 1.
formula: E.g.f. for a(n+1), n >= 1, log(c(x)); c(x) = g.f. for Catalan numbers A000108. - _Wolfdieter Lang_

Integral representation as n-th moment of a positive function on a positive half-axis, in Maple notation: a(n)=int(x^n*erfc(sqrt(x)/2)/2, x=0..infinity), n=0, 1..., where erfc(x) is the complementary error function. - _Karol A. Penson_, Sep 27 2001
E.g.f. (A(x)-1) is reversion of exp(-x)-exp(-2*x). - _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Jan 30 2012

G.f.: 1 + x*G(0) where G(k) = 1 + x*(2*k+1)*(4*k+3)/(k + 1 - 4*x*(k+1)^2*(4*k+5)/(4*x*(k+1)*(4*k+5) + (2*k+3)/G(k+1) )); (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Feb 02 2013

E.g.f.: 1 + x*E(0) where E(k) = 1 + x*(2*k+1)*(4*k+3)/(2*(k + 1)^2 - 8*x*(k+1)^3*(4*k+5)/(4*x*(k+1)*(4*k+5) + (2*k+3)^2/E(k+1) )); (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Feb 02 2013
D-finite with recurrence (-n+1)*a(n) +2*(2*n-3)*(n-2)*a(n-1)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 03 2018

A006964.name: Number of directed rooted trees with n nodes.
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = x*exp(3*Sum_{k>=1} A(x^k)/k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Mar 19 2018

A006965.name: Number of directed trees with n nodes.

A006966.name: Number of lattices on n unlabeled nodes.

A006967.name: Number of graceful permutations of length n.

A006968.name: Number of letters in Roman numeral representation of n.

A006971.name: Composite numbers k such that k == +-1 (mod 8) and 2^((k-1)/2) == 1 (mod k).

A006972.name: Lucas-Carmichael numbers: squarefree composite numbers k such that p | k => p+1 | k+1.

A006973.name: Dimensions of representations by Witt vectors.
formula: G.f.: Product_{n>=1} (1 + a(n)*x^n/n!) = exp(-x)/(1-x). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 14 2008

A recurrence. With FP(n,m) the set of partitions of n with m distinct parts (which could be called fermionic partitions (fp)) and the multinomial numbers M1(fp(n,m)) (given as M_1 array for any partition in A036038): a(n) = (-1)^n - Sum_{m=2..maxm(n)} ( Sum_{fp from FP(n,m)} (M1(fp)*Product_{j=1..m} ( a(k[j]) ) ), with maxm(n) = A003056(n) = floor((sqrt(1+8*n) -1)/2) and the distinct parts k[j], j=1..m, of the partition of n, n>=2, with input a(1)=-1 (but only for this recurrence). Note that a(1)=0. Proof by comparing coefficients of (x^n)/n! in exp(-x) = (1-x)*Product_{j>=1} ( 1 + a(j)*(x^j)/j! ). See array A008289(n,m) for the cardinality of the set FP(n,m). Another recurrence has been given in the first PARI program line below. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 24 2009

A006974.name: Coefficients of Chebyshev T polynomials: a(n) = A053120(n+8, n), n >= 0.
formula: Binomial transform of a(n)=(24*n^4-134*n^3+261*n^2-130*n+3)/3 offset 0. a(3)=220. [Al Hakanson (hawkuu(AT)gmail.com), Jun 01 2009]
a(n) = 2^(n-3)*binomial(n+3, 3)*(n+8). - _Brad Clardy_, Mar 08 2012 [See a comment in A053120 on subdiagonals. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 03 2020]

A006975.name: Negated coefficients of Chebyshev T polynomials: a(n) = -A053120(n+10, n), n >= 0.
formula: G.f.: (1-x)/(1-2*x)^6. a(n) = 2^(n-1)*binomial(n+4, 4)*(n+10)/5, for n >= 0. [a(n) from Mar 06 2000 rewritten. See the _Brad Clardy_ formula below, and a comment in A053120 on subdiagonals. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 03 2020]
a(n) = binomial transform of b(n)= (2*n^5 + 10*n^4 + 30*n^3 + 50*n^2 + 43*n + 15) / 15 offset 0. a(3) = 364. - Al Hakanson (hawkuu(AT)gmail.com), Jun 01 2009

A006976.name: Coefficients of Chebyshev T polynomials: a(n) = A053120(n+12, n), n >= 0.
formula: a(n) = 2^n*binomial(n+5, 5)*(n+12)/12. [See a comment in A053120 on subdiagonal sequences. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 03 2020]

A006977.name: Cellular automaton with Rule 230: 000, 001, 010, 011, ..., 111 -> 0,1,1,0,0,1,1,1.
formula: Numbers suggest a rational g.f. with denominator (1-x^4)(1-4x^2). - _Ralf Stephan_, Jun 09 2005
G.f. seems to be (1 + 3*x + x^2 + 3*x^3 + 2*x^4 - 4*x^5)/((1 - x^4)*(1 - 4*x^2)). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 11 2017

A006979.name: a(n) is the number of compositions of n in which the maximum part size is 5.

A006981.name: a(n) is the number of unlabeled modular lattices on n nodes.

A006982.name: Number of unlabeled distributive lattices on n nodes.

A006983.name: Number of simple perfect squared squares of order n up to symmetry.

A006984.name: Greatest minimal norm of sublattice of index n in hexagonal lattice.

A006985.name: Fibonacci tower: a(n) = F(a(n-1)+2) (there is no room for next term).

A006987.name: Binomial coefficients: C(n,k), 2 <= k <= n-2, sorted, duplicates removed.

A006989.name: Log of g.f. of numbers of preferential arrangements.
formula: E.g.f: log(1 + integral(B)) where B is the e.g.f. for A000670.

A006992.name: Bertrand primes: a(n) is largest prime < 2*a(n-1) for n > 1, with a(1) = 2.

A006994.name: Number of letters in n (in Russian).

A006995.name: Binary palindromes: numbers whose binary expansion is palindromic.
formula: A178225(a(n)) = 1; union of A048700 and A048701. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 21 2011
Written as a decimal, a(10^n) has 2*n digits. For n > 1, the decimal expansion of a(10^n) starts with 22..., 23... or 24...:
lim sup_{n -> oo} a(n)/n^2 = 1/4, lim inf_{n -> oo} a(n)/n^2 = 2/9.
Recursion for n > 2: a(n) = 2^(2k-q) + 1 + 2^p*a(m), where k = floor(log_2(n-1)), and p, q and m are determined as follows:
Case 1: If n = 2^(k+1), then p = 0, q = 0, m = 1;
Case 2: If 2^k < n < 2^k+2^(k-1), then p = k-floor(log_2(i))-1 with i = n-2^k, q = 2, m = 2^floor(log_2(i)) + i;
Case 3: If n = 2^k + 2^(k-1), then p = 0, q = 1, m = 1;
Case 4: If 2^k + 2^(k-1) < n < 2^(k+1), then p = k-floor(log_2(j))-1 with j = n-2^k-2^(k-1), q = 1, m = 2*2^floor(log_2(j))+j.
Let n >= 3, m = floor(log_2(n)), p = floor((3*2^(m-1)-1)/n), then

a(n) = 2^(2*m-1-p) + 1 + p*(1-(-1)^n)*2^(m-1-p) + sum_{k=1 .. m-1-p} (floor((n-(3-p)*2^(m-1))/2^(m-1-k)) mod 2)*(2^k+2^(2*m-1-p-k)). [Typo at the last exponent of the third sum term eliminated by the author, Sep 05 2018]
Inversion formula: The index of any binary palindrome b = a(n) > 0 is n = palindromicIndex(b) = ((5-(-1)^m)/2 + Sum_{k=1..[m/2]} ([b/2^k] mod 2)/2^k)*2^[m/2], where [.] = floor(.) and m = [log_2(b)].

G.f.: g(x) = x^2 + 3x^3 + sum_{j=1..oo}( 3*2^j*(1-x^floor((j+1)/2))/(1-x)*x^((1/2)-floor((j+1)/2)) + f_j(x) - f_j(1/x))*x^(2*2^floor(j/2)+3*2^floor((j-1)/2)-(1/2)), where the f_j(x) are defined as follows:

A006996.name: C(2n,n) mod 3.
formula: A fixed point of the morphism : 1 -> 120, 2 -> 210, 0 -> 000. - _Philippe Deléham_, Jan 08 2004

A006997.name: Partitioning integers to avoid arithmetic progressions of length 3.

A006998.name: Partitioning integers to avoid arithmetic progressions of length 3.

A006999.name: Partitioning integers to avoid arithmetic progressions of length 3.
formula: a(n+1) = (3*a(n))/2+1 if a(n) is even. a(n+1) = (3*a(n)+1)/2 if a(n) is odd. - _Miquel Cerda_, Jun 15 2019

A007000.name: Number of partitions of n into Fibonacci parts (with 2 types of 1).
formula: G.f.: Sum_{i>=0} x^Fibonacci(i) / Product_{j=1..i} (1 - x^Fibonacci(j)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 07 2017
